Reviews.Title: “This is not 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: rj w
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK, but expect 4 star at the absolute most. The decor is tacky and dated and it certainly didn't feel 5 star. The views are good from the 8th floor and above (below that I can only imagine they're awful). The bed sheets were dirty when I arrived (I asked that they be changed which they were), the bathroom door had water marks / spots on it which should've been wiped off and the bathrobe was worn and old. The room was small and the bathroom was tiny. When room service was ordered, it took a riduculously long time and the queue on checkout was far too long. The bed was extremely wide but sadly not long enough.

Reviews.Title: “overnight stay in a quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeyG007
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short break in london. took a chance on a secret hotel deal. when we arrived we were greated with a warm welcome. our room was upgraded as the smoking rooms were not ready so had a executive double with balcony view of tower bridge and the gehrkin, clean tidy and well laid out. beware of taking anything out of the mini bar as it is eclectrically monitored and added to your bill.. food and drink expensive but a great little weatherspoons down the road. great location and a well presented hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 5 star. 3 star at best!”
Reviews.Author: Warne87
Reviews.Content: Room was tiny and the bathroom was terrible. We were really looking forward to a great 5 star experience and although the foyer was nice, the room was a complete disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “More like a 3 star, disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: yggdrasil1
Reviews.Content: Much like another recent review from the moment we entered the hotel we were looked down on and treated badly. Why allow casually dressed people into a 5 star hotel if you cannot treat them like 5 star guests?! After waiting for the 2 receptionists to get off the phone we finally got our room. On entering the whole room smelled greasy due to the huge pile of takeaway rubbish under the desk (see photo). I found a member of housekeeping who cleared the mess and apologized profusely. Fair enough. It got worse. The minibar looked like somebody had take a crowbar to it! There was a long line of sharp tacks sticking out, there were also items of food in the air conditioning vent! If all this was not bad enough our room was entered twice and serviced even though the "do not disturb" sign was on the door. On the second occasion our clothes which were laid on the bed for us to change into after we returned from lunch were moved and the bed made. We were late to the Hyper Japan exhibition where we were representing our company. The worst part of all this is the complaint. I wrote an email telling the hotel about all of this. They contacted me back and told me that the room was NOT dirty, the room was NOT serviced when we said it was, there is nothing wrong with the minibar and there was no food in the air conditioning. Even with the photographic evidence and another person to verify my story they told me I am lying. or to be exact: "Our reports, door lock readings and cctv footage are at variance with your comments and completely contradictory. I can see no benefit to you or us in detailing each of these at this juncture" This is the reply from Mary Doogan Group General Manager Grange Hotels So,...I would advise anybody considering staying at this hotel not to. There is a travelodge a few minutes away at a fraction of the price and with half of the expectations! (at least you know where you stand with travelodge). For something more upmarket try the tower hotel by Guoman (owners of the cumberland in Marble Arch) which overlooks the river and is 4 star but a whole lot better than this. This is NOT a 5 star hotel. It does not offer the service standards, politeness or cleanliness you expect at this level and to tell a complaining guest that they and their partner are lying is just appalling at this level. I am taking my complaint to both trading standards and the tourist board. I have also moved all business trips to another chain and urge anybody reading this to look elsewhere for accommodation at tower bridge. P.S. All photos were taken on the day of arrival, the 3 blurry looking ones are of the food in the air conditioning unit, looks like somebody couldn't stomach their breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “5* if you think travel lodge is as good as it gets.”
Reviews.Author: Jamie J
Reviews.Content: Firstly can I state that I approach this review with experience as a hotel manager and also of the sometimes unreasonable expectations of the guest. Also, my two night stay was purchased as part of the 'lastminute' franchise and therefore can reasonably be expected to be a discount experience. On entering the hotel my partner and I where rudely asked by the doorman if we were 'looking for the right hotel', now although slightly frayed from travel neither of us is tree hugging hippies nor tracksuit wearing whatever the phrase would politely be. We are both professionals and at no point do I expect to be spoken down to by a doorman when in relaxed albeit smart denim and shirt mode; simply this is plain rude. This disdainful attitude was continued at the reception desk and was nothing more than unwelcoming. On entering our room, we encountered a small room that was not overly clean (sticky headboard -I dread to ask) on the ninth floor overlooking the railway track. The view I could live with, but the room was one of the worst I've ever encountered (I have stayed in cleaner more spacious 2* accommodation in Italy, that as someone of Italian descent I expect the bare minimum from). In fairness to the hotel I complained to the reception and they changed our room to one on the sixth floor overlooking the old city wall that was far nicer. However, the room still did not match up to my experience of even four star accommodation and the loitering member of staff who clearly wanted a tip for the hotels bad service was plainly painful to watch (recall that awful scene in home alone 2 that we all thought was a joke?). Finally, my last gripe with this hotel is the insalubrious bar, frequented by the very worst type of coked-up businessmen who believe their own hype. It was a horrid atmosphere and a most unwelcome one to have unsuspectingly taken my partner to after a lovely evening out in the city. These type of patrons can be encouraged to act like gentleman by the staff and the best way to start is to employ female staff as well as male and to actively discourage the type of customer whose experience of women is escorts (simply fella's if you want a nice weekend with your wife DO NOT end it in the Isis bar). The hotels location is otherwise excellent; but so are many others and they are not that long a stroll. I for one won't be visiting this Grange hotel again, it ruins the reputation.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy13_7
Reviews.Content: I requested a high floor with a view a week before I arrived and was told that the booking had not gone through yes but reservations said they would call me.They didn't.When I arrived at 12.45 I was told that the room was not ready until 2pm, yeah right! So I said I would like a high floor for the view and was told,no problem.After a long stroll I came back at 2pm and as I checked in the polite girl said "You requested a high floor, let me see, is the 6th ok?" I said yes. When I got into the lift I was miffed to see there were 12 floors. I WAS NOT EVEN IN THE TOP HALF!!!!!!!!!! When i got to the room the view was the back of the hotel over looking a brick wall.I couldn't be bothered to complain. The room was a good size had iron/board, bathroom good for London and the breakfast quite nice. marked down by one as reception the couldn't give a dam.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic view from the 12th floor”
Reviews.Author: gbba15408
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a number of times usually on special occasions. This time we were most fortunate to be given a suite on the 12th floor. What an amazing view of the Tower and the Bridge from our gorgeous room. The staff are always so very pleasant and helpful and our breakfast was first rate. Excellent service with the most friendly and efficient staff you can imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: Melissa Q
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 1 night during December as part of a Christmas Package. The package included complimentary upgrade to a Deluxe room, late checkout at 2pm, a 3 course meal, breakfast in the morning and a spa treatment. We stayed in a large room on the 9th floor with a beautiful view. In the evening we went to the main restaurant for our 3 course meal. The restaurant was fairly empty which meant more attention was given to us and our food was prepared quickly but was still very delicious. In the morning the restaurant was busier and the breakfast was buffet style with plenty of selection. If you don't opt for breakfast included it is quite pricey at Â£19 per person! Overall I was very happy with this hotel, would definately recommend it and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great private dining experince”
Reviews.Author: Knowmygrub
Reviews.Content: Went there this week for Dinner with 30 of us having private dining in a suite. Excellent service, friendly and efficient staff but simply outstanding food. A really really good meal, well above and beyond what one would normally expect on the budget. As a Country person, i found the main course of Lamb to be truly outstanding. Congratulations! Will definately recommend we return again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Room without view and very week Wifi”
Reviews.Author: mesogeia
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located from Tower Hill tube station, less than 1 min walk from it. My room was all right except that it did not have view at all. It was facing to the inside of the complex and all I could see was the wall. Besides, Wifi was VERY weak in the room and I needed to go by the door to get a decent connection. For the price they charge (more than 200 GBP per night for a single without breakfast), I think it was unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel near Tower Bridge”
Reviews.Author: cpfc1984
Reviews.Content: A superb hotel close to Tower hill tube Station. Stayed here for a mystery weekend and was impressed by the overal standard of the hotel.Rooms were extreamly spacious and clean. Standard ofservice was good and overall it was a very good experience ffor the price. One tip if you dont want to spend the usual high price for breakfast , turn left out of the hotel and head for the weatherspoons pub on the corner which does a superb range of breakfasts for Â£4.99

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view”
Reviews.Author: VickyL_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night as a treat and the view was incredible! Tower Bridge, Tower of London, the Shard and the Thames. Breathtaking. Staff very helpful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking view, great service and amazing spa”
Reviews.Author: jitkajnr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location, just a couple of steps from Tower Hill tube station, when we got to the reception, we found an amazing Indian receptionist who was really helpful and kind, he gave us a room at the 9th floor, which was right next to Tower Hill, we couldnÂ´t believe it: the view was just breathtaking! The room was really nice and equipped and another nice surprise was the SPA: 25m swimming pool, steam bath, sauna, jacuzzi... I definately recommend the hotel. The reception was also really flexible, as we were partying the last night and they let us check out at noon without additional cost ;-)

Reviews.Title: “good location poor service”
Reviews.Author: kirka35
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in December 2011 Location is good if you want to be in the City The hotel is somewhat outdated Service is poor- it seems the stuff is not getting proper trainning Food is no bad Rooms are large but ourdated Have to ask for everything twice and call and follow up to make sure you receive what you ordered: be that room service, cab order or the check out bill...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and perfect position”
Reviews.Author: LouUK83
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve stayed at this hotel 3 times now, and I always enjoy my stay. The staff are friendly and professional, the public areas are clean, and the rooms are spacious. Some of the furniture in the rooms could do with being replaced, however, and I always end up with a room overlooking the train station, rather than the Tower of London. The pool area is lovely, and the bar and restaurant are also good. Itâ€™s so convenient the City and itâ€™s close to Tower Hill tube station. I look forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Georgie G
Reviews.Content: We booked this through Lastminute.com and got it for far cheaper than most lesser star hotels. It was in a good central location close to Tower Hill station. The staff were very friendly and offered us a complimentary luggage check-in service even after we had checked out - a real boon when you're 'doing London'. We were a little disappointed with the room and couldn't work out what was '5 star' about it as the porter had also told us he had 'upgraded' us. The view from the window was of the train tracks and a high rise building, no horizon in sight despite the hotel reviews online. We got stung the next morning when discovering breakfast wasn't included in our Lastminute package and paid Â£46 for 2 full English breakfasts! Most expensive sausage and eggs we've ever had... Still it was an enjoyable experience and the free use of the spa facilities made it all worthwhile. :)

Reviews.Title: “Quite Impressed - Spa Needs Attention”
Reviews.Author: HelenA1074
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via lastminute.com and was pleasantly surprised. Upgraded on arrival, friendly receptionist and very clean throught. Excellent location for tube. Food was excellent, but avoid the Japanese restaurant - overpriced and not up to standard expected. The main reason we booked was for the pool/spa. The main pool water was cold, and the jacuzzi could have been hotter. The shower area hot tap didn't work and the drinking fountain also didn't work. Steam room and sauna perfect. Breakfast was good, but a bit over-priced I thought. Tea/coffee facilities in room also plentiful. Would definitely come here again for a weekend break. Beds a bit on the hard side, but this is probably down to personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz but good value”
Reviews.Author: Barclay12
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Grange. Upgraded to an executive room with a great view of Tower Hamlets. Massive bed and comfortable bedding. Staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful and have to say the leisure centre staff were great and the Pool was massive. I would recommend this hotel for any London weekend experience Only negative was the bathroom which was dated and in need of a refurb.

Reviews.Title: “Superb.....”
Reviews.Author: 007BV
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel over the weekend and must say that we really enjoyed every aspect of our stay...the staff, the room, the food and all the facilities we used were 5 star rated Excellent hotel and great value - we will be back

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: yvonne_brown
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd stay at the Grange City. It is a good Hotel near the tube. Staff are welcomimg and the continental breakfast was adequate. Just a couple of things for the hotel to note - the Long Life milk in the room had gone off. It is kept in an area above the fridge so the heat from the motor made it warm. Also the room itself was not very warm - had to put the heating on whenever we used the room. After walking around London in the cold a warm room is lovely to walk into - not on this occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Grange cannot do 5 star Hotels, disappointed again”
Reviews.Author: Adrian S
Reviews.Content: This is the second Grange Hotel I have stayed in the last month(the first being St Pauls). Again I was disappointed you are not welcomed at the Hotel and the staff are not helpful. I arrived at the Hotel was not greeted at the entrance or given assistance with my bags. According to the AA star rating a 5 Star Hotel should greet guests on entrance, on the 3 days I was there I was not once greeted. I checked in and again not offered help with my bags. The room was quite nice although there was a problem with the air con which took six phone calls and 3 hours before the staff bothered to do anything. The Hotel is 1 minute from Tower Hill Tube and is near the City and Tower Bridge so is in good location. The only problem is that 95% of the bars in the vicinity are only open Mon- Friday. Surprisingly Saturday nights in that area are dire. So you have to travel further a field on a Saturday. The on site gym and swimming pool are very good and well equipped. The bar in the hotel did not have friendly staff and the service was appalling. Also I tried the room service and paid Â£14 for the worst Pizza I have ever had, why it was so bad is beyond me but you can get frozen pizza's in the supermarket for a couple of quid which are ten times better. I would only recommend this hotel if you can get a very good deal on the price. It is certainly do where near the standard you expect from a 5 Star Hotel. Grange Hotels clearly do not tell the staff to be friendly, welcome and look after their guests. Half the rooms have a good view over the Tower of London the others have a really poor view. Not very good value and there are alot better 5 Star Hotels in London. I have also found with Grange that although they say "Best Price Guaranteed" on there website you can get the rooms cheaper on other websites and Grange won't match those prices even when you phone up and query it, bizarre?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but a few mishaps getting there....”
Reviews.Author: GreenLady101
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the St Paul's Grange Hotel, which out of the two I would definately recommend as a better hotel and overall experience. I booked to stay for two nights at the Grange City Hotel. I also booked a package of chocolates and champagne to be surprise in our room that my partner didn't know about. When we arrived (check in from 2pm onwards) our room wasn't ready, we were told it would be a few minutes. After 45 minutes of watching other people check in we went back to reception explaining that we had tickets for wine tasting and the theatre that we would be late for if we waited any longer for the room. The receptionist apologised (this was probably the 3rd time we had returned to the desk asking when the room would be available). During check in the receptionist actually discussed that we had a "package" in the room, I gave her good eye contact in which she suddenly realised that this was suppose to be a secret. Luckily my partner didn't hear but I still thought this was quite poor and a bit tackless. When we eventually got the key to our room we had to literally dump our bags and go which gave us no time to enjoy the extras. However the hotel did provide an ice bucket and ice for us to enjoy the champagne later. On the second day we stayed our key was also locked and stopped working in the morning which we had to see reception about. This was cleared up very quickly but an inconvenience we could have done without. Overall the hotel was lovely but out of choice I'd definately choose to stay at the St Paul's Hotel. The staff appeared more organised. Then again my experience wasn't bad enough to make me never stay in this hotel again, as all the facilities and room was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location but not 5*.”
Reviews.Author: mckenna851
Reviews.Content: I booked this via a deal on lastminute.com. It stated a 5 star hotel however I fail to see that this hotel is 5*, possible more a 4*. That said, the location was excellent. Unlike previous reviewers, I also arrived early and was told to come back after 2 pm. They advertise "female friendly" wing however as a lone female, no mention of this was made to me and I was given a room on the 8th floor. No view but this was not surprising given the cost of the room. Avoid breakfast if it isn't part of your package - the cost of Â£23 is extremely excessive given that there is a Wetherspoons just along the road which gives very similar fayre for Â£5. Reception staff were polite but not over-welcoming. Agree with other reviewers that staff are mostly non-English native speakers and when I requested grapefruit segments at breakfast I was given a whole, unpeeled grapefruit. I was also served my cooked breakfast before I had finished my cereal. The room was comfortable and clean, but the bathroom was a little bit dated with no separate shower (unlike other 4* hotels in the area). I put my towels up rather than have them changed every day however they were changed anyway! Also, I had on both days my facecloth taken away and not replaced. Would I stay here again? Only if I got a cheap deal. Having stayed at the Apex City of London Hotel which is a 4* hotel, this hotel doesn't come close.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: eameser
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times now, the most recent being new years eve, this time we stayed in a suite on the 12th floor all very nice and fantastic views over the tower of London and tower bridge from our room but had to complain 4 times, heating did not work, over charged at checking out, room service was wrong and had to argue with the restaurant manger over the breakfast when the waitress made a sceen over full english. This is a nice hotel but as other people has stated is looking a bit tired our carpet was lifting, wall paper ripped, no heating (even after maintenance spent 30 minutes). but as central London hotels go this is excellent value for money if you can get a deal which is normally easy at weekends if you book in advance. If you are looking for good value but good quality and can plan in advance then I would recommend this hotel every time.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff tired room”
Reviews.Author: ouzo09
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night midweek at thus hotel. Booked via secret room on last minute.com. Think hotel only gets 5 stars due to facilities ie health club. Good pool but changing room old fashioned and quite basic. Jacuzzi out of order. Room was clean but felt dated several chips to wood work and view into offices. Staff very friendly. Ate in bistro/ wine bar no atmosphere very bland. Certainly not 5 star. Food okay but again basic. At best this is a four star.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Libliz
Reviews.Content: Try to get a room on floors 8-11 (or a penthouse on floor 12 if money is no object!) for stunning views. If you can't manage that, take the lift to floor 11 and find the sofa tucked round the corner to relax and take it all in. This is a superb hotel, with excellent facilities and very comfortable rooms in a very convenient spot very close to Tower Hill tube station (Circle and District lines), the DLR and Tower Pier. I thoroughly recommend it, but with one tiny remark, which is why i didn't rate it 'excellent'. Watch the small print very carefully! For example, 'complimentary newspapers' actually means 'complimentary Independent' - if you order any other paper, they charge you. And a 'superior' room isn't actually superior to an 'executive' room; it's the other way round, confusingly.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless....”
Reviews.Author: deeps3
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel on three seperate occasions and must say every visit is better than the last.... As the hotel already had my details on their system, when I stayed the second and thrid time round I was upgraded on both occasions..the third visit i made, my room was upgraded with a view of The Tower of London and Tower Bridge. The hotel itself is situated with easy access of the undergound, which is handy .... Room Service - prompt, friendly and a wide choice of snacks/desserts to order Staff - friendly and helpful Rooms - spacious and clean

Reviews.Title: “Best location for our business, but noisy location”
Reviews.Author: tls416
Reviews.Content: we just returned from a week at the Grange City Hotel. It was a great location for our business trip but would not stay there again. It was within walking distance to Lloyds of London and in an area with some quick restaurants and shopping. It is next to the tube which will get you anywhere. The hotel staff was very helpful directing you to the sights and which train to take there. They had a very nice buffet breakfast available with many choices. The in room coffee choices were instant and it was very bad, tea was available. The bed was very comfortable and our room had a large bathroom. The bad thing about the hotel was the loud noise. They were doing construcion across the street well into the middle of the night, which was very loud since our room faced the street. The worse night was Friday night where the nightclub noise rocked the hotel until the middle of the night. The walls are paper thin, you can hear the tv and phone conversations of the people next to you. If you want a hotel with a location that works for your business with nice and helpful staff this will be a good choice. Just be aware of the noise issue.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, Friendly and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TeamMason
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to London for the weekend and this was a perfect location to see a lot of the sights. We were upgraded to a larger room with a great view of tower bridge. Staff could not have been more helpful, including helping us find the name of a restaurant we wanted to eat at with minimum information and making a separate pot of 'tea' (milk) at breakfast to make my little girl feel all grown up. Unlike other posts we had the most comfortable bed and our turn down service came every evening. Lovely pool too. I would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: freddiekuu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for one night for a theatre trip to see Wicked. Great location on a good tube line. When checking in asked about room upgrade to over look Tower Bridge however this was at an extra charge (Â£55) . Advised we didnt want this however the friendly receptionist advised she would 'see what she could do' and said she had allocated a more spacious room. Was allocated a room on the 9th floor and had a lovely view - river to the left and 'Gerkin' to the right and everything else in between. Room was clean and comfortable. Big comfortable bed :) Continental breakfast was lovely and we didnt feel it was worth upgrading to full English! We did go in the pool - 'Grecian feel' however due to low roof was noisy and had a big group in so was hard tor relax - worth a visit though! All in all a lovely hotel in a brilliant location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Braskpedersen
Reviews.Content: For the second we spend a weekend at the Grange City Hotel. We had a very nice stay. Good service from the staff and a large room with all the amenities which were needed. We had the continental breakfast which was well assorted. The hotel is located 100 meter from Tower Hill subway station. We can recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not a 5*.”
Reviews.Author: Sujo1
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through secret rooms . We were put in 2 rooms overlooking the train station. As many other reviews have said I think that if you end up staying in a wing of the hotel the rooms are 3*. Our bed cushions had stains on them and it was a bit grubby. The breakfast the next day was v expensive for what it was. Does a 5* hotel really serve tea in a thermos flask? The location is great. For what we paid it was just about ok.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Isle of Wight, England, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Grange City Hotel 7th to 9th January 2012”
Reviews.Author: Richard S
Reviews.Content: Booked through secret hotels lastminute Â£259 for 3 days room only. Excellent location for Tower Hill Tube (1min). Tower of London Tower Bridge St Kathrines Docks Thames Boat Trips and Restaurants on the otherside of the bridge. Room 605 was lovely clean kingsize bed with nice sheets bed clothes pillows cushions air con hot and cold great bathroom complementry shampoo conditioner body lotion etc balcony views of the bridge tower gerkin etc. Drinks in the bar not bad for london pint draught cobra and glass wine Â£9.25 good access via tube to central London. Spa also very nice. Recommend this Hotel for an enjoyable site seeing London break

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: wozzah
Reviews.Content: Myself and my Fiancee stayed here for New Years Eve and New Years Day. Room was very clean and spacious with plenty of wardrobe space. Bathroom had a great shower but room itself, probably not as good as you would expect from a 5 star hotel although very clean. Pool area is quite nice and a welcome break from the hustle and bustle of the City. There is a small hottub, along with sauna and steam room. Gym looks fairly well equipped although we did not use it. The bar in the hotel is quite chilled and open late and the drinks were not particularly expensive for a City Hotel. We had the continental breakfast which was well stocked up and enough choice. All the Staff were extremely helpful. Great location for seeing the sites as right next to Tower of London and tube station less than 2 minute walk. Overall a very good hotel but probably not really a 5 star, which I think is reflected in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but not 5*”
Reviews.Author: Love_Yorkshire
Reviews.Content: Great location, right next to Tower Hill station/Tower of London. We had a room on the 4th floor (405), round the back of the hotel. This was a complimentary upgrade to an executive double. Rooms were very spacious, the furniture almost looked lost. The bathroom was over-large and very strangely set out, a bath with a shower in addition to a separate shower cubicle, but only one basin when there was room for several more. The bed was very comfortable, and it was extremely quiet given its city location. It was the first week of January so there may have been fewer guests than usual. We booked this hotel at a great discount, not sure I would have paid the full rate. Staff were very helpful, although the man repairing the telephone lines (affecting credit card payments) wasn't exactly rushing. Overall it had a bit of a strange feel. Over-sized rooms and not much in them. Both my partner and I woke up with a headache, we think there may have been something wrong with the air conditioning. We didn't experience breakfast as it seemed overpriced, but there are lots of alternatives close by. The hotel bar was welcoming and bustling. Overall it was a nice enough corporate style hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beckiboo1983
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for my birthday, on a "Romance Package" booked by my boyfriend. I also recently stayed in the 5 star Corinthia hotel, so was expecting pretty much the same standard - how wrong was I! The hotel is quite dated and has tired furniture. Our room was pleasant enough - we got upgraded to an executive room which had a view of the Tower of London, albeit an obscured one due to the office block next door. The room was large, as was the bed. However the furnishings were very old - the telephones looked like they were bought in 1985, and the overall decor of the room was not very modern. I didn't mind this too much as sometimes the most modern rooms arent necessarily the best. The spa was quite nice, a Roman theme with a large pool great for swimming and small-ish steam/sauna rooms etc. I had a massage which was passable, although the masseuse was very friendly. Our package included dinner in the restaurant. I know we went in Jan 2012 but this huge restaurant was absolutely deserted. The food was nice, but the service was terrible. Upon arrival we were asked if we wanted a bottle of water, yes we said - and 30mins later we were still waiting for it, gasping of thirst. Our bottle of wine after 40mins, and the starters about 50mins. Nearly an hour to wait for your wine and starter - not good. The breakfast was passable, again, nothing 5* about this for me. It was bog standard English breakfast made from bog standard quality food. I was still eating and had put my knife and fork down on my plate (apart), when a waiter proceeded to swipe it from underneath me! I had to explain I was still eating - this is simple table etiquette - you would think a waiter in a 5* hotel would understand a guest has not finished if her cutlery is sitting apart on her plate. Again - I kept comparing this with previous hotels. It just seems that the staff here do not have a clue. Our package included a late checkout of 2pm. At midday I got a call from reception asking whether we would check out, I explained we had the room until 2pm and they apologised. We went down to the spa for a final swim etc, upon arrival back to the room, we found to our horror the keys had been de-activated and we were left stranded in our wet robes in the corridor. We had to hunt around the floor for a chambermaid to let us in. Very annoying! I feel that this hotel may have been a 5* years ago, but it most certainly is not now. It has all the makings that it could be 5*, but years of neglect, and hiring staff who quite simply do not understand what service is required have made this a very disappointing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Be VERY careful booking this hotel”
Reviews.Author: auditt225
Reviews.Content: I booked a two night stay at this hotel through Lastminute.com for New Years. I used one of their Top Secret deals and would not by choice have booked a Grange Hotel as I have had mixed expereinces with them. The Top Secret deal turned out to be Â£30 cheaper (Â£300 v Â£330) for two nights but did not include breakfast and was therefore more expensive - beware! My real complaint is about the room allocated on arrival - room 110. The room was ok for a bit dated 4*, but the bed was terrible. It creaked every time you moved, had a very thin mattress (about 15cm) and even the thin mattress was totally 'shot'. We just couldn't believe how bad it was (not even 2*). Then we realised why they had sold us a 'syndicate' room where the bed folds back into the wall - it was a put you up bed! At a 5* price unbelievble! The room/bed were described as 'superior double' - more like very inferior.... The Guest relations Lady was very good but lied "Oh I will have to get housekeeping to look at that we have NEVER had complaints about that room before..." Really???? They moved us to room 632 which was fine for a 4* room with a nice view of the Tower and the top of Tower Bridge. The hotel appears to have several 'wings and then one to the left as you face the building is the old one - I am guessing that the newer ones may 5*??? but not the one we were in. So the purpose of this message is a warning to all future guests at the Grange City to beware lastminute.com, and also to ensure you don't get a room with a terrible bed that folds into the wall. They should never attempt to sell such rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: 21and
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November as a surprise for my 40th, on check in we were upgraded to a executive suit which was totally superb, we were on the 6th floor our room had a massive terrace area which over looked London Bridge,and The tower of London. On check in the reception staff were very polite and helpful as was all the staff at breakfast time. This hotel offers a super service and would defo stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Â£28 for two Gin & Tonics and a closed Sushi Restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: Lawyer11
Reviews.Content: Certainly not a 5 star Hotel but with 5 star prices! Pool was cold, jacuzzi tiny and aroma room not working but hey maybe we could go for sushi in the Japanese restaurant instead. Oh no, it's shut. Let's go to the bar instead and have a drink of Gin & Tonic. One drink later and a bill for Â£28 it's time to go back to our room feeling pretty ripped off and wondering where the value for money went from what seemed like a reasonably priced room. You live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_Bath_uk
Reviews.Content: 1st Visit to hotel, stayed for two nights after boxing day, Hotel is very conveniently located, just two minutes from Towerhill tube station and 1 minute from Fenchurch Street Railway Station. On arrival reception staff was very helpful, and welcoming. Room was beautiful and very well furnished. We asked if we could extend our stay at the same rate, receptionist spoke to manager and immediately agreed even after the offer was no longer available. Breakfast was excellent. Overall hotel is very well staffed and not that expensive considering the location.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice Xmas stay”
Reviews.Author: MrMmrsM
Reviews.Content: 2nd visit to hotel. stayed Xmas day and got a room upgrade. very nice room, lots of space. Big bed but the mattres was a little hard for our liking. Could see tower bridge (just) from our window. staff very helpfull. hotel bar good and not that expensive considering the location. very close to DLR and tube station. also within a short walk of tower bridge and the tower of London. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “good night's stay”
Reviews.Author: Barganax
Reviews.Content: We booked in for one night as part of the Christmas season treat. The hotel is well sited opposite the Tower of London, though needs to be found as it is down a narrow olde street. The reception was bright and welcoming and this review is hoping there is a swift return of my Â£50 room deposit. The room was HUGE, two double beds and a settee. The window overlooked a courtyard with the old London Roman wall. I was impressed by the cleanliness and the presentation of the room. The bathroom had both bath and shower. Beware, my wife is on the small side and the bath is so large she could almost swim in it. We did not eat here as I thought Â£20 for breakfast a bit strong. However there are bars, pub grubs and cafes galore nearby. We were not bothered by any noise so could not comment on whether it was a quiet night or well soundproofed.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Frank S
Reviews.Content: Stayed there recently booked via lastminute. Great location & easy to find, right around the corner from Tower Hill tube station. Arrived quite a bit earlier than the published check-in time of 3pm but girl at reception got me a room, with a smile and no fuss. Room was on the 11th floor with view of the gherkin (see attached pic). Room seemed clean and modern, well working aircon/heating, nice bathroom and more pillows on that bed than you'll ever need. Also seemed very quiet and had a good night's sleep. Didn't use the breakfast but from what I saw, and for the price and the location (right opposite the tower & tower bridge) it's spot on value for money in London - would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Redeemed themselves !”
Reviews.Author: Phil A
Reviews.Content: Stayed here earlier in the year and was disappointed as a hen party on the same floor totally rui9ned the trip. Not the hotels fault and so after some negotiation revisited with an upgrade. The hotel excelled themselves. Service / check-in / reception were all first class. Food at the restaurant was superb and not overpriced. Well done Grange !

Reviews.Title: “Bog Standard”
Reviews.Author: Spartak A
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grange City Hotel as part of a weekend in London with my girlfriend. We originally booked a double room which was (i think called a superior). Trust me nothing about this room was superior - now you could blame me for booking one of the more basic rooms however when you consider this is a 5 star hotel in central London you would think that even the most basic room would be alright. I'm going to be harsh to the hotel, but what i will say is that you don't want any of the basic double rooms. If you're going to go there, book one the larger better rooms (we got upgraded) which are far nicer.

Reviews.Title: “nice but not sure what makes it a 5*”
Reviews.Author: JoMark79
Reviews.Content: The accommodation was fine, clean, tidy - but small. The facilities were good but not sure what differentiates a 5* from a 4*. View of office block even though documentation promised a great view - to be fair we could just see the gherkin over the office block. Breakfast seemed to have a very limited selection. No English! The location of the hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: IRBaboonLondon
Reviews.Content: was underwhelmed at all levels by this hotel, previously stayed in grange tower hill which is excellent but this was poor and overpriced in summary you can get a similar hotel eg a hilton etc for half the price of this or something much better such as andaz for the same price - style is very soviet and terribly dated, all brass / bronze and mirrors and dark wood, nice when its new 30 years ago but very dated now - reception is always busy and time consuming - its impossible to work in rooms, so dont go on busines, the tiny table is taken up by a tv and radio bolted to it so no space for a laptop, barely even a fone - sound proofing is poor so prepare to be woken up by the chav xmas party brigade at this time of year -breakfast is never included in the rate and the grange breakfast / menu pricing is complex and you cannot have a coffee with buffet breakfast without paying 30 pounds for full breakfast, very petty - bathroom looked about 30 years old did not appreciate a mangy rubber mat in the bottom of my bath, shades of travelodge, in fact most travelodges are better -service in bar and reception good, doesnt make up for other failings

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear”
Reviews.Author: Mervyn X
Reviews.Content: This hotel should have been really nice. Nicely decorated, great location and pleasant staff. Instead I had a horrible night. Upon arrival I was told I had received an upgrade to an executive room free of charge. Not a bad start I thought. So off I went to the annex and found room 110. Hardly executive. It was nicely furnished but the bed was very unusual to say the least. I seemed to have been pulled down from the wall. A kind of a " put you up " affair only a little more substantial, or so I thought. The internal walls were a weird kind of partition set up and the bathroom was tired. Anyway, I retired to bed and was comfortable enough, until around 4am the matress and I began to fall through a gap in the wooden slats. I sank and sank and sank. It was one of those sleepy moments went I thought to myself, this is a weird dream I'm having. Anyway, I got up and attempted some running repairs. I'm not really at my best at 4am, my DIY skills are limited at the best of times. But I was stark raving naked as well. I struggled for a few hours and switched between falling through the hole and rolling around on my hands and knees attempting running repairs. I complained the next morning. There was a que at reception o I spoke to a lady sitting at a computer screen in the lobby. She informed me her screen had frozen but she took a note of my email address and promised to get back to me. I'm still waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning!!”
Reviews.Author: buttonsbabe86
Reviews.Content: We stayed here sunday night and could not speak highly enough of the hotel. The circular reception, like others have stated can be a bit confusing when busy about which side is checking in or out etc. However, the reception staff and concierge couldn't be more helpful. Check in is at 14:00, but we arrived at 9am and they allowed us to leave our bags so that we could go and enjoy london and come back to check in later. This also applied as we departed, we could leave our bags there and come and collect them at the end of the day (we collected as late as 10pm) after some more exploring. Our stay couldn't have been more pleasant, we booked it as a top secret hotel on lastminute.com and think it was a fantastic deal. They knew that it was my 25th birthday and kindly upgraded us. It was a huge room with 2 double beds, a living area and an amazing view across to london bridge and the tower of london. Simply stunning after dark. We went out for the evening, and the turn down service had obviously come when we were out as the blinds had been closed, decorative pillows had been tidied off the beds and chocolates left on our pillows, simply ready for us to flop into after a long delightful day. Highly recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Walking into another couples bedroom was interesting”
Reviews.Author: jean m
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully presented, although the circular check in desk causes confusion when busy. When we eventually found someone to check us in on Friday evening, we were given a room on the second floor. When we tried the door it was occupied by another couple. Luckily not to embarrassing. We were then given another room on the sixth floor, as we were not told which lifts to take, we were looking for a room that did not exist. On the third attempt the manager escorted us to the room, why he knocked on the door before he entered was a little worrying. Who were we going to confront this time? Our request for a complimentry taxi (as were were now over a half hour late for the event we were attending) was ignored, despite my husband booking numerous conferences and rooms at this hotel each year, They did not seem concerned that they could lose this contract. Fortunately, there was a change of staff over night and the breakfast and check out went without a hitch. We were not the only people complaining that evening at one point we had to wait in line. But all that said, the decor and comfort of the room was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TraceyC2504
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in December 2011 and had a really enjoyable stay. Reception staff were very helpful and check in was quick and easy. Other staff we came across were pleasant and amiable which was a nice touch. Rooms were lovely and we had a great view of Canary Wharf. Fabulous location and easily accessible to tube station..... About 100m walk to Tower Hill. Overall, great hotel which we would stay in again and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay - average spa.”
Reviews.Author: ambernectar85
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in november this year, for one night only. Reception - helpful, efficient. We were checking in on a sunday afternoon and it was not that busy. Room - amazing view of tower bridge and the thames (ask for a room with a view). The room isnt huge and neither is the bathroom, and the door swings shut all the time which is extremely annoying. All usual mod cons, tv player, bose radio, tea/cofee facilities. The decor is quite depressing, all dark colours and dark wood. Food - expensive (in main restaurants). We ate in the bar which was nice and relaxed and the fajitas were amazing! We also had breakfast here which was cheaper and you get to watch the world go past the window. Spa - Nice pool, steam room much too hot and very bright, no atmosphere. Facial was nice, but felt very much like a production line, no time taken to explore what i wanted etc. The lady came in and said, ok so you relax now (like i could just do it on demand)... No candles, and she kept squeezing past my bed to get to the water tap to rinse her sponges. Thorough facial but was not relaxing and felt quite impersonal. Overall - nice hotel. No major concerns, but lacks the personal touch, and less depressing decor!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Dave186305
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight with my wife. They chose to give me an upgrade to an executive room. Great! Got to the room. What a disappointment! Considering it is supposed to be a 5 star the room was small and pokey and crowded with dated furniture. The sofa was stained, the curtains were hanging off, the bed covers were stained, the Capet was frayed and stopped you from opening the fridge, the cupboards were scratched, the bathroom had paint peeling from the ceiling the list goes on and the worst was the bed, it was so hard sleep was impossible getting up was painful. This is not a 5 star more like a 3 star. If you want style and comfort find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Always deliver”
Reviews.Author: Jean-Luc B
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel about 4 times now and it always seems to deliver. Check-in can be somewhat chaotic sometimes, but I blame it on the circular design of the front desk and it is not usually clear who's next in line. The check-in team is always very pleasant and helpful. The spa is good and they have a lovely bar area albeit we have noticed that communication with the bar staff can be sometimes be challenging. Breakfast is always lovely but please do expect to queues at times. The rooms are immaculately clean, spacious with high ceiling, nicely decorated with lots of original features and they have lovely spacious bathrooms. On our second visit we were upgraded to room (613 I think) which was genuinely the largest hotel room I have ever stayed in even larger than a family room. We've always been allocated nice rooms so I believe it is fair to say that all rooms are nice and spacious. I have seen the review about the wall facing room - we have stayed in one of those rooms before, but I think ours was on a slightly higher floor and the wall is more of an original feature rather than the contrary. We have never dined in the evening. This hotel is extremely convenient, an easy 2 minute walk from the tube station and 5 minutes walk to tower bridge. It is not on main road, more of an access road so it is one of the quietest hotels I know in London. I work for a Relais and Chateaux property and have worked for a Leading hotel of the world previously before and I can be extremely critical when I stay away but I would totally recommend this 4 star property and I think it serves its purpose very well.

Reviews.Title: “Not even a three star...”
Reviews.Author: Lso77
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel. The only pro is that the tube and London tower is right next door and in fairness the room service was prompt and food not bad. Coffee was cold. Front desk service was rude. Concierge rushed me and very rude. Also very difficult to understand. This was my first time in London and I felt the people on the street gave me better information then the hotel staff. The rooms are dingy and small. Bathroom size very very small. I will never sty here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best anniversary ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Fromhereandthere
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on the last weekend of november, and the staff went a little extra step for us. We were celebrating anniversary and got a room on the 10th floor with a breathtaking view from the Tower and Bridge of london. We loved the turn down service in the evening, we had afternoon tea and we regret not enjoying more time at the hotel. Morning breakfast was ok, quite predictable, however service made a difference. The location is perfect, right out of Tower Hill Station, metro and DLR, busses. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel right at the heart of the City of London”
Reviews.Author: casimir200
Reviews.Content: Warm welcome, excellent service, comfortable bedroom and bathroom, lot of space for a hotel in London. We had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant but not 5 star, beware if there is a function on”
Reviews.Author: Novak2011
Reviews.Content: Overall a very pleasant stay in London, nice hotel good location but never 5 star, compares to some 4 star I have stayed in but not as good as some other 4 star. We had the mispleasure of staying when they had a function on, which you would think they did quite a bit of. The noise was dreadful and we were at the opposite end of the hotel, wnet on until past midnight. Hotel apologised but their offer of a discount and free breakfast next time we stayed was insulting.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is NOT 5 star”
Reviews.Author: kate m
Reviews.Content: This hotel is NOT a 5 star. The room we had look directly over a tube station. Every time we opened the curtains everyone on the platform looked up at us. The "double bed" was actually two twins put together so both nights I ended up wedged between them. I've stayed in many a 5 star and there was not one single thing about this hotel that is 5 star. It is directly opposite from the Tower of London but a good half hour tube ride and a change over away from the main shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight in town - Theatre trip”
Reviews.Author: 3B
Reviews.Content: Arrived late afternoon, smooth check in then up to our room on floor 3 for a freshen up before heading to the bar for a pre trek to the theatre drink and snack before going to see a show. Room was large and there was some aircon in the communal areas from the lift which was appreciated. Large twin double bedded room with a sofa, roman blinds and heavy dressed curtains, double glazing, TV,fridge, Tea/Coffee, hairdryer, toiletries. Bar area - nice and clean well laid out good service, we had drinks and a snack of Nacho's & curly fries, they also bring you a dish of assorted nuts and are happy to refil (took back to room for later) There is a pool/ spa but did not have time to investigate this area. In the morning breakfast was included in the price, it is a continental one unless you wish to pay another almost Â£9 for a cooked one. Pleanty of choice, ceral, fruits, yoghurst, breads, meats, cheese, pastries, more than enough to keep you going. Checkout was smooth and simple, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would expect and more!”
Reviews.Author: Richnkirst1
Reviews.Content: Great location, great styling and an all night bar for when you get back

Reviews.Title: “Good location, big rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mr_R_Baron
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very nice, if you are lucky you get a good view. If you are unlucky you get a view of Fenchurch Street station. Bar is open late. Plenty of bars nearby and if you want to visit the tower of london, it's just over the road. The England cricket team often stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fayNewcastle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night for my son's birthday. I got a great price booking as a top secret hotel and we were also upgraded to a Tower Bridge view on arrival. The reception was spacious and well presented and check-in staff were very professional. Our room was a good size, well decorated and spotlessly clean. The view of the bridge was stunning. Throughout the night we heard no noise from other rooms which was great, in fact it was lovely and quiet and we got a great night's sleep. We didn't try the swimming pool or other facilities as we were too tired after a day sight-seeing and we didn't eat at the hotel so I can' comment on these. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would love to return on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a business trip in the City”
Reviews.Author: BarcelonaTourist
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the City. It is new and the rooms are really comfortable. The gym facilities were not opened yet when I stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room, Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Gillie86
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay here as a Secret Hotel, This was our first visit to the hotel and we had no complaints at all. We arrived quite late on a Friday evening, checked in straight away and were upgraded. The upgraded room was huge it had everything you could possibly need. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff who were extremely helpful throughout our stay. The Hotel has a great location, very close to the Tower of London and also the nearest Tube station I wouldn't hesitate in staying again and we've recommended this to all our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Another run of the mill London City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CTCTraveller
Reviews.Content: I remember this hotel being one of the first in the financial City of London but because it was next to my then office, I never had reason to stay there. I did so this week while visiting form the Middle East, where I now live. I was disappointed - it is aging and whilst this may have a certain rustic charm, the overall impression I got was that it was a bit tired. I could not fault my reception - all was handled very well by a friendly staff and an efficient doorman. My Club Floor room was large, comfortable and well fitted and whilst it was not as clean as I would wish, I have no real complaints other than to make comment that the Club floor extras, mineral water, robe, etc, were not provided as they should have been. Its worthwhile reading what you have paid for and checking that you actually get it. Oh yes, and watch that shower in the bath (not seperate) the controls are counterintuitive. I only used the main restaurant (looked like a huge ballroom with tables) and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food from the rather limited menu. I enjoyed dinner there on the first day of my stay so I went back again the next day and had the same meal (!) but this time the quality had really faded - all was overcooked. IT access in the room was FFF (fine, fast and free) for the Club Floor but I did not use any of the spa facilities as I was too busy. I missed breakfast (again seemingly served in the abovementioned ballroom) as it was neither in the price nor provided in a Club Lounge. I also refuse to pay the best part of $45 for a light breakfast on top of an already expensive room (US$450+). However, on the price issue, if you want a good room, weekday, in a London financial City hotel, this is the sort of rate that is now being charged by all - it seems to have gone up exponentially in the last year. Finally, the Club Floor room had a late check out (14.00hrs) but when I asked to have this facility, I was told that they had changed their mind and I must check out by 11.00hrs. After I checked out early, stored my luggage with the concierge and then collected it again at 2.00pm, I was told on enquiry again, that I should have checked out at 14.00hrs as I was staying in a Club room ! ! The upshot was that, seemingly, a trainee was not up to speed with the Club floor rules and I had been misinformed - an apology at least would have been nice. An overall summary ? Expensive, friendly but aging fast - until they renovate and have more efficient staff, there are better options not 100meters away (Novotel, Mint Hotel, Apex etc). Pity - there is something I like about the place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great room and rate, but 5 stars?”
Reviews.Author: evayoOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night while being one of those couples joining the trend of booking an hotel room blind of what that hotel might be. The Grange city is a stone's throw from the Tower of London and it was welcoming a trove of weekenders with only two receptionists, therfore the que to register was quite long. My giirlfriend had left the key in reception but I didn't want to wait in line, so I asked a bellboy how to get to our room and he sent me in the wrong direction! The hotel does feel small but the furnishing and finishes are quite nice. The bathroom is covered in marble, which is pretty nice. Regretfully we didn't had a great view towards the tower of london, instead we had a perfect view of a train station. The hotel has two buildingds, and all rooms up to 30 on a given floor are on the main building, and the rest are on the adjacent building. That's where we stayed, room 339 if you want to know. Overall the price we paid for a weekend was a steal for a 5 star hotel. But this ain't a 5 star hotel, therefore we were overall very happy but won't necessarily come back.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay at Grange City”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa_Barker_2004
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay as a Secret Hotel on a last minute site. Room was upgraded on arrival. We were offered a smoking room an hour or two before official arrival time first of all which we tried then declined due to the stale smell. We rang Reception and were promptly shown to another upgraded room on the 4th floor which was larger than the first one with walk in shower and additional shower over the bath in a larger than average bathroom with a good selection of toiletries. Turn down service with a chocolate left on the bedside table was a nice touch. Loud Music could be heard playing from a function that evening (Saturday) but this stopped at about 12.30 am so it wasnt a problem to us since we had already enjoyed a drink at the local pub on our way back to the hotel after an Evanescence concert. The next door neighbour had unfortunately tried to drown out the noise by watching his/her TV on a very loud setting!! Continental breakfast was adequate and the staff were courteous and efficient during breakfast and on arrival and departure. The Conceiurge was very helpful when much of the London underground was closed due to maintenance and we needed to get over to the Apollo Hammersmith. The hotel is in walking distance of Liverpool Street stn. Approx 15-20 min walk. The swimming pool is very large and the steam room, aromatherapy room and sauna were very good. The jacuzzi however was very small and barely fitted four people - cosy! We have stayed here twice now and we would recommend it if you can find a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Shoe box room”
Reviews.Author: hammers40
Reviews.Content: Room was very small the bathroom was no bigger than a broom cupboard however it was clean and the staff helpful

Reviews.Title: “A Great London Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hayley435
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grange for one night at the weekend as a birthday treat. The hotel has a very nice reception area and check in was quick and easy. Our room was on the 5th floor and an added bonus for us was that we had a balcony from which we could see the tower of London, city hall and the river. There were 3 of us staying in the room so we had a double bed and a sofa bed. The sofa bed is the most comfortable I have slept in which is very rare! There was plenty of room for all of us. The rooms have all the amenities you would expect from 5 star, tea and coffee, hairdryer, iron etc. The location was ideal for us but it's obviously not the closest to central London attractions. Tower Hill tube station is just a 2 min walk away and the number 15 bus goes straight into central London and only takes about 15-20 mins. A taxi cost Â£12. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for tube and tower of London”
Reviews.Author: shabangle23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over a weekend in October 2011. Fantastic location just a few steps from Tower Hill tube station which is so easy for getting around. Our room overlooked the Gherkin which was a nice extra snd even though it also overlooked the train line into Fenchurch St station there was no noise pollution. Good room facilities,huge bed,lovely bathroom and very well equipped. The spa and gym are fantastic. Didn't eat there so can't comment on that. Overall it was great and even better that we got a good deal as a top secret hotel on lastminute.com

Reviews.Title: “Good weekend value and great location”
Reviews.Author: PhillipB29
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel very reasonable for the weekend rate charged. Not a 5 star but certainly 4 star quality and standards. The staff were very accommodating in assisting us with further travel bookings and provided free internet access for as long as we wished. Although our room overlooked a tube station, we could not hear a sound from the rail line nor feel any rumblings from the line. The location is excellent for visiting most of the tourist locations...and for access to the hop on hop off bus route and underground.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Tower, great weekend value”
Reviews.Author: Bigbadbob6224
Reviews.Content: This is genuinely a 5 star property with all the services and amenities you would expect. Because it caters to a business crowd, the rates are VERY attractive on the weekends. Also weekend rate includes continental breakfast. Close to Tower of London and even closer to Tower Hill tube stop and Fenchurch Rail station. Perhaps not ideal for kids or young people.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel - do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Hannah G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for Halloween weekend and we were disappointed from the very beginning. I am not the type of person who complains often but I was really so disgusted with this hotel, I felt it necessary to warn other not to throw their money away on this far from 5 star hotel. When we arrived the check in desk was quiet with only one other guest in front of us so we did not have long to wait. The manageress firstly could not find our booking as she was searching under my first name instead of my surname (even though I had presented her with my confirmation email.) She was also rude enough to answer the ringing telephone when she was in the middle of our check in and her colleague was sitting idle beside her. We were given our check in cards and told to go to room 219 on the second floor and were directed to the elevator. Off we went to the second floor and found signs pointing to directions of rooms up to 218, no 219 to be seen. So, we dragged our luggage back down to reception (no one had offered to help with the bags) and spoke to the receptionist again. She could not figure out the reason for this and ensured us there was a room 219 on the computer....it took a further ten minutes to figure out that she had directed us to the wrong wing of the hotel. So off we went in the elevator on the other side of the building to find the mysterious room 219. When we finally arrived to our room we were greeted with a beautiful view of the tube stop which was around 5 meters from the window. The room itself was tiny with barely enough room to fit ourselves and our luggage. The bathroom was also tiny. No bathrobes provided in the rooms - these were only available upon request. Breakfast prices were extortionate with an extra 8 pounds being charged for hot breakfast and and extra 4 pounds per person for room service!! When the maid came to clean our room we left to give her space (far too limited for 3 people) when we returned we found it strange that our coats had been moved from the chair. Later when my boyfriend checked his pocket he discovered 20 euro had gone missing from his coat pocket. A drink in the very quiet bar later that evening took us fifteen minutes to be served. When checking out the receptionist asked how our stay was. We told him we were not at all happy with it. He did not however ask why or try to make amends at all. In summary, I found the staff unhelpful and incompetent and the hotel to be sub standard. It is definitely not a 5 star and I would never stay in this hotel or any other in the Grange hotel groups again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5* hotel”
Reviews.Author: tony p
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend ended up in a small room with little space to move around. Would have expected a larger room for what we had paid. Room service was very good, although drinks expenisve ( Recommend going to bar for drinks beforehand and taking them to room) but food prices were reasonable. Although recommend finding places to eat before your arrival. Swimming pool was lovely and very big. Weatherspoons round the corner very cheap! Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: melanie1109
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in mid October and were given a free upgrade upon arrival. Lovely spacious room with 2 double beds (room 1108) and beautiful views of the Tower of London and London Bridge - very nice. Beds extremely comfortable - we had one each! Continental breakfast included, more than enough choice. We did pay the extra Â£8 per person for full english breakfast once but meal was not warm so stuck to continental the following day. Conveniently located next to Tower Hill tube station and outside the Tower of London many open top bus tours operate for the tourists guide of London. Within a 5 minute walk there was a local pub (The Minories) offering value for money pub grub or a Wetherspoons, again cheap and cheerful. The leisure facilities are free of charge and it has a beautiful pool, sauna and steam room - quiet and a nice way to start the day. Overall we had a very enjoyable weekend and paid 3 star prices for 5 star quality. Only disappointment was the fact that I had given a debit card deposit which they took the full amount of the stay plus additional deposit on, and then upon check out they took the full amount. It was 3 days before my bank account was credited - something new to me so in future I will pay cash on arrival!!!

Reviews.Title: “Should be 6* hotel”
Reviews.Author: nadinne
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last weekend for 4 days, previously have stayed in a few London Hilton hotels. This hotel is excellent in every way that a tourist would need. The location from the tower hill tube is 50 metres, the service was professional with a smile on any issue. The room was more like a suite, we had booked a twin and it had 2 king size beds, sofa, two comfortable chairs and lots of amenities such as x box, flat screen TV, wireless internet and full spa and pool free to guests. Brilliant bathroom products which were constantly replenished as were towels and bathrobes. We had a view of the Thames and tower hill. You had enough room in the mini bar which was a full size fridge for any of your own bits and pieces. We had breakfast included and I cannot think of anything that was not provided, again with a smile. The staff are very well trained and knowledgeable and not once when we requested extras or information did they have to refer to another manager or team leader. This made for a fast and efficient service. You need to count yourselves very fortunate if like us you get a good deal at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not convinced by the 5 star rating”
Reviews.Author: 66coronation
Reviews.Content: Well located. Clean room. All facilities in good working order. Comfortable and clean bed. Just like any other 3 or 4 star hotel. Except the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mike m
Reviews.Content: No compliants exactly as described! The breakfast was not the best, thats the only downside, the room was great, the bar was good. The pool and spa was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “It's quiet on Friday nights!”
Reviews.Author: DevonGrace
Reviews.Content: The review of 14 October paints a bleak picture. We also stayed on the night of October 14 and had a completely different experience. We had an ordinary room. True, rooms do look over the tube station and you can see BUT you cannot hear any trains. Our room was very cool and the air-con worked perfectly. We didn't hear a sound during the night. The awful picture of the curtains in the previous review is because they are just for show and should be left tied up. The blinds behind them are effective. In addition, our room was spotless. We had complimentary water and the usual tea and coffee. Very comfortable bed. Next morning the restaurant, where we had a continental breakfast, including a range of cold meats and cheese and warm boiled eggs, in addition to soft rolls, cereals, fruit and juices. Service was excellent, quick and courteous. This was a surprise treat for us from our daughter. We were so delighted, we plan to return in the near future for a theatre break.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel beware of the nightclub noise nearby”
Reviews.Author: jaynewilliamsjb
Reviews.Content: My husband and i along with my daughter and mother in law had a night stay in this hotel as we were visiting the Tower of London the following day, the hotel is very nice the swimming pool area was also very nice but the swimming pool is was very cold to swim in. The thing which lets this hotel down is there is a nightclub/bar of some sort near by as from 10pm to 3am we could near a constant hum drum beat and also could feel the beat in our room, our rooms were at the back opposite the train line , i went down to reception about 2am to ask if they know of a nightclub nearby but wern;t aware of one and said it must be from someones room but i can honestly say it was without any doubt from a nightclub , they did however offer to change our rooms but at that time of morning we were going to be checking out in a few hours we declined the offer.

Reviews.Title: “business in London”
Reviews.Author: Merlin1967
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, close to everything, comfortable bed , will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Dependable time after time.”
Reviews.Author: Tredelerch
Reviews.Content: This is a highly dependeable hotel in an excellent location. Due to it's proximity to the City, it offers superb prices for Friday and Saturday nights, which we have taken advantage of on a number of occasions. The hotel is located next to the Tower of London, Tower Bridge, River Thames and St Katherine's Dock, and is well served by Tower Hill tube station (Circle and District lines), which is less than a minutes walk away. On arrival, we were pleasantly surprised to find our room had been upgraded at no extra cost - not sure why, but nice all the same. The room was on a high floor, quite spacious, clean, air-conditioned and well appointed. At no time did we here any noise from other guests, which made our room a peaceful haven on a hectic weekend. Breakfast was the only meal we ate in the hotel. Continental style was standard, cooked being an extra charge. We found it very good and plentiful but, as in most large London hotels, get down early if you don't want to queue! The staff seemed to work extremely hard to make all guest's feel comfortable and at home. We felt that the restaurant staff, reception, cleaning staff and concierge were all exceptionally good. We did feel however, that the staff in the bar were not the most welcoming or friendly, which was disappointing. We have stayed here a few times before, and can see no reason why we would return next time we go to London.

Reviews.Title: “What a depressing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lablanche
Reviews.Content: I had been here a couple of times on business and could remember the relatively old rooms, which were however spacious and relatively comfortable by London standards. So I wasn't expecting too much but still, this time was more than a disappointment. After a lengthy check-in procedure, I am given my room key. After a long wait in front of the lifts - one being out of service - I get to my room (supposedly an "executive king room") and I can't believe my eyes. A place where sunlight can possibly never enter: the window faces the wall of another building - litterally less than a meter away - and the only view you get is a ventilation grid from the adjacent building. After inspecting the room itself, all worn out and definitely not very clean, I go to the reception asking for another room - something I've only done a couple of times in my lifetime. The staff is very helpful and diligent and gets me another room. Which turns out to be almost as dark and much smaller actually... A bit cleaner and with a bit of a view... on the nearby railway tracks - still not great and very depressing! But at this point I give up. I'm just here for business anyway. As the room is incredibly hot I need to put the airco at full power - which is very noisy. On the following day I decide to leave the airco on in order to cool down the room before I return, therefore I leave one of my 2 room keys in the slot which acts as a main switch for the power in the room - making sure however to switch off all the lights before I leave. And when I return I find the airco switched off again and my second key is taken away!!! In conclusion I will never go there again. The are much, much better alternative in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Premium London Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Petertoto
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as i was attending a conference in London. I booked last minute not knowing what to expect. The hotel was superb. the check-in was smooth, the staff courteous. What I couldnt believe was the how convenient the hotel was to London with tower hill tube 2 mins walk away. I was fortunate to get upgraded to a nice suite the room was huge by London standards. the room was airy spacious and the bathroom had 2 showers 1 in the bath and a seperate cubicle.The air-conditioning worked well it was needed, especially at unseasonal temperatures of 29c in October. I didnt eat here so dont know what the food was like. I would certainly recommend this hotel. i normally stick to the branded ones such as Sheraton, Hilton or marriott. This was an unexpected surprise. I will definately book again for my next trip.Well done Grange

Reviews.Title: “A real five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: CriticsView
Reviews.Content: Managed to secure a good deal and found this Hotel to live up to the five star rating. Close to the Tower etc and everthing you would expect from a top quality Hotel. Staff were attentive, room was well presented and clean. Lovely pool area; Overall an exceptional Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel with an excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: tinylass
Reviews.Content: We somehow managed to find this hotel at a fantastic price which is not usually the case for a 5*. We were blown away by the reception area when we arrived with the bloke all dressed up outside the main entrance welcoming you in! It was the perfect hotel for a short stay in London being 1 minute walk from the nearest tube station and the Tower Bridge. The rooms were luxurious and spotless, the breakfast had everything you could want, the staff and service couldn't be falted and again, the location was spot on. The only slight downside was the view from the window which was just a side street; but what do you expect in London city centre? Overall, a great hotel and would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: BunnyII
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated for either business or pleasure. The room was very clean and comfortable. Only one concern - I used a washcloth and hung it to dry in the shower.. housekeeping removed it when they cleaned the room but did not replace it. So the next day I used the remaining washcloth and same thing - housekeeping removed it but did not replace it so I was left without a washcloth. The spa is beautiful and very clean, but unfortunately the hot tub was not working and although the staff said they would call when it was working again, they never did call.... Overall, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to Tower & City”
Reviews.Author: CRadmac
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on recommendation of workmate - had a special price (because of transport changes and mid winter). Good hotel close to City and Tower. Close to Tower tube - be careful as tube station can be closed for weekend work. Bit of a walk to Bank (or catch the bus). Room for one person was small, but clean.
