Bit noisy at night (it was a Saturday and there was a wedding ....) Breakfast was great and filling. Staff friendly. Great location to explore City

Reviews.Title: “Good housekeeping & pleasant staff!”
Reviews.Author: Meenakshi M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September 2011 while on a business trip. This was the first stay and so I was a bit concerned. The mid priced hotels in london tend to be a bit of a gamble. This was a find. The housekeeping was top notch. A clean bed, bath and room is critical as far as I am concerned. Everything else takes second place. Which is what I found with this place. The rooms were clean and decent sized (by London standards) the rest was just ok! Staff were good but most spoke English with a strange accent (This coming from an Indian could be considered priceless) and were a bit raw in terms of their knowledge of the locality. I may come back.....not yet decided!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: smudge382
Reviews.Content: A glamorous hotel, with welcoming staff in an excellent location. Reception/check-in and check-out was quick and efficient, and the concierge staff in the hotel lobby were helpful. The bedroom and bathroom were very clean, the bedlinen was high quality as were the towels. A plentiful supply of various teas and coffees were available in our room. We didn't use the minibar but it looked very well stocked. The bedroom had an efficient heating/air conditiioning unit. On our second night we dined in the hotel restaurant, which was wonderful, the food, wine and service were absolutely excellent. We didn't have time to use the spa and pool facilities but we plan to stay there again and will make time on our next visit. All in all, an excellent hotel stay in a really good hotel. If you need to park, use the Minories car park just around the corner, very reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: terry999
Reviews.Content: Not perfect but nearly. Good rooms, very clean. Good service. Better than average for London at a reasobale price.

Reviews.Title: “central place for touring city”
Reviews.Author: VeeBee08
Reviews.Content: had a long weekend at this hotel to see a show, do some shopping, & see the sights. great service, clean room, food reasonably priced for a 5 star hotel, & very tasty too. staff always ready to help. it's well placed for most of the best things london has to offer. would definitely stay there again. checking in, & out was fast & pleasant, not a boring formality as in other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: jonzgirl
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Grange City Hotel while in London for business. This time we were traveling with another couple and had made the arrangements, paying in advance. Due to flight cancellations and delays, we ended up the hotel after midnight instead of 8 a.m. as planned. I knew we were in trouble when they asked our name, looked at each other and walked away for a brief conference. When they returned, they said they'd had an emergency with another family that had to remain in our room for an extra day. This would have made sense except that we had two rooms and neither was available. Needless to say I was not happy. Not to mention that these rooms were prepaid and should not have been given away no matter what time it was. They offered to taxi us to another one of their properties approximately 10 minutes away. The next morning our husbands were picked up for their business meeting and later in the morning they sent a taxi for us and our luggage. While the other couple did not fare as well, we were treated to a room with a phenomenal view of the tower, bridge and river. The hotel is beautiful and the food in the lounge was very good. We stopped there for a quick lunch while waiting for our husbands to finish up their meeting. The only thing that stops me from giving the excellent rating was the screwup with our rooms. We will probably be returning to London and giving the Grange City another chance.

Reviews.Title: “good short stay in London”
Reviews.Author: Christina_Uk
Reviews.Content: A last minute trip to London. We were given a lower rate - which turned out to mean a room at the back of the hotel over looking the car park. As we were paying such a low price I knew I couldnt afford to be too fussy but the staff were really friendly and helpful and they did change us to a higher floor room. Room was great, well furnished and great bathroom accessories. Tube station 2 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “really modern hotel excellent location”
Reviews.Author: S_walesNeil
Reviews.Content: really helpful staff had early check in and late check out 12 pm but our coach wasnt leaving until 19.00 no problem had a safe room for our bags and used the spa to freshen up towels included before we set off on our journey home faultless

Reviews.Title: “Easy review”
Reviews.Author: jdavat
Reviews.Content: It's seldom I write a review but this one is easy. In my 50 odd years of visiting and staying in London this hotel is easily the best I have stayed in. If you like swimming too(which I do) then it's even better !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough, but not 5 star special”
Reviews.Author: Boo1000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on a quick weekend break to London. We managed to book an excellent deal (Â£108) for a double and the room and hotel exceeded what I would expect for that money in London. Pros - excellent location for tourists and business people in city. Just a few strides from the tube and Tower of London, and easy walking distance to the City, St.Katherines Dock and St.Pauls. Staff were friendly. One of a few hotels in London with a 25meter swimming pool. Some rooms will have great views of the tower, bridge & river. Our view was at the back and therefore of the city; but still very good. Our room had a well stocked mini bar and a Bose stereo (but no ipod dock!). There is a turn down service and i have to say our room at the back provided one of the quietest sleeps I've had in London. Cons - the aircon in the room was very poor, the rooms are a bit dated and worn around the edges. The bathroom had had some 'repairs' with filler around the edge of the bath it wasn't well done and this made it look grubby. The bathroom just felt less than 100% clean. All in all for the money it was excellent and for the location and good sleep I would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service and Great Lost and Found for the Forgetful”
Reviews.Author: Niblik2010
Reviews.Content: The Tower Bridge district is 'up and coming' for London, and this property is a fantastic contribution and good value for money. From the moment I walked in the door, I felt welcome, and all questions were answered at check in. There were opportunities to take advantages of guest services as well as the concierge, and both services were quick and very helpful. The room was a very comfortable standard with top-end bath, generous toiletries scented with White Ginger, chocolates by the bed, and the television was on welcoming me. The bed was very plush and slept well. Unplanned was leaving something behind. When I rang toward the end of the day I checked out, they offered to look and ring me back. Within 10 minutes, they found the item and called. I wasn't able to pick it up for several days, and they had it logged and safely stored when I stopped by. Better than anything was the woman at guest services who took my call initially and recalled who I was upon my return. Quite an impressive operation and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: JinxieDub
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two days in August and were very happy with the hotel. We got a special offer and were a bit nervous about what to expect, but it far exceeded our expectations. We didn't eat there, but we had a drink in the bar and the staff were lovely. The location is ideal - next door to Tower Hill Tube station and Fenchurch St station - perfect for getting around and about and you also have a great view of the Tower of London. Staff were nice as well. A very special mention goes to Balazs the concierge who was extremely helpful and a pleasure to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: dinieh
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, nice and efficient staff and a superb location: Tower area, St Katharine Docks just around the corner. If you want to stay in a more relaxed part of London this is the address! You can either choose to explore London by tube (Tower Hill station around the corner) or walk to the Tower Pier and take one of the numerous cruises to Westminster or Greenwich. Through the Grange hotel site we booked the very interesting summer holiday special offer and even got an upgrade to a large twin room with direct view on the tower! Nice birthday present! I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: naomi o
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partener this august. It was a very easy place to find - not hidden. We went there as a one off treat and turned up in casual clothes, the staff looked at us and said can we help you very rudely, we then said we had a room booked. They looked at us in shock. We both felt they really did talk down to us. We got to our room quickly and i had to inspect as im a cleaner myself! There was dust, dirt, feathers under the bed. The bathroom was tiny! The blind was broken and ealry in the morning the next day the outside windows were being cleaned!! so they just stared right in. The bed was very big but very hard and my partener woke up with alot of bites so did i, we had been bitten in the night?! Everything else was lovely, the furniture, the pool, sauna, steam room, aromatherapy room and jacuzzi. The breakfast was to die for! It was a huge buffet of everything you could think of. It is worth getting the breakfast for the amount of money! I dont rate this as a 5* maybe a 3-4* and it is not worth the money. I would go back if it was Â£100 a night, not Â£275. We also paid for rose pettles to be put on the bed and that never happened. We also got charged twice which put my partener over drawn.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: Mitrvls
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OK, we got a good late deal on the price but beware everything else is very expensive - given the view from the back is over fenchurch street station this is ok for a short stay. Stayed in worse..but stayed in much better. Ask for a non station viewing room.

Reviews.Title: “Let down by inefficient and inconsistent housekeeping!!”
Reviews.Author: FranceSuzy
Reviews.Content: Excellent decor, rooms clean and comfortable. Breakfast was included in our rate and there was an excellent hot and cold choice. The swimming pool and spa were very clean and inviting and it was lovely to be able to wind down here after a day's sightseeing. Unfortunately the whole experience was let down by the most inefficient and inconsistent housekeeping I have ever experienced. I did complain to the Duty Manager but nothing much changed. A shame our stay was let down by irritatingly inefficient housekeeping. Only worthy of 5 star status if service improves. .

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5-star hotel, 4 might be pushing it”
Reviews.Author: jjcantab
Reviews.Content: I got a last-minute deal for this hotel -- the location is convenient for the City (and City Airport), the rooms tidy, but a luxury hotel this is not. Think business value hotel. The first room we were shown faced the platforms (and trains) of Fenchurch Street station. I would have preferred going home with the commuters rather than staying there. The second (and final) room we were offered was much nicer and more spacious (and quieter), but still felt a bit dated and spartan. It did have a kettle and free (albeit slow) wi-fi. Fortunately I was only here for a night so I didn't make a big deal of it, but I would have been depressed if I had to spend a week. I didn't try the extortionate Â£23 / person breakfast so can't comment on that, and also didn't venture into the health club which might be nice.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice. 5* experience was great.”
Reviews.Author: Daithi0806
Reviews.Content: Went with the wife and daughter. Fantastic hotel. Just beside tower bridge underground station. Hotel staff were so friendly. Pool facilities were top class. Highly recommeded. Only snag is the steps from reception to lifts and from reception to bar. There is a small lift for wheel chairs and prams for the lift but its not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Spa weekend visit - very relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Cat_Brighton1
Reviews.Content: Just a quick review to say that we stayed here on a lastminute.com secret hotel deal and thoroughly enjoyed it. We took full advantage of the pool and spa for the whole weekend (we stayed Saturday night only but you can use the facilities on day of departure too) and found it so quiet we sometimes had the pool to ourselves! Room was a nice size, clean and with a large lovely comfortable bed. Great location, right by Fenchurch Street mainline and Tower Hill tube and a black cab from Covent Garden was around Â£10. Staff were friendly and helpful. Would come again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Tower and Greenwich”
Reviews.Author: foodienews
Reviews.Content: Great view from the room and Japanese restaurant was excellent. Be warned children not allowed in the pool at any useful time of the day....and the recommended carpark is the most expensive one in the area... Will use it again though as good price in school holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Room but just an OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChadinNYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights this past summer and the hotel was overall fine. The room was larger than I would have expected considering most of the European hotels I have stayed in were rather cramped. Our room had a King sized bed and a full-sized pull out couch that made it very easy for three travelers to lodge together. The staff was friendly but not very helpful. Since the hotel is located in the financial district, it is very quiet at night and the area is dead on the weekends with the exception of the Tower Hill tube stop (very conveniently located on the corner of the hotel). On one Saturday morning, I asked the front desk where I could get coffee in the neighborhood and they told me, "Nowhere. Everything is closed." I walked out the door, made two right turns and found a Pret right there, open for business. The concierge cannot really do more for any traveler that they could not do for themselves on a laptop. We tried to go to the hotel bar the first night but after standing at the bar for 15 minutes waiting, we ended up going across the street to another hotel's bar which was much nicer and had much better service. The hotel is not centrally located if this is your first time in London but if you don't mind hopping on the tube to get to the major attractions, it is not a bad deal. This is a hotel for the no-fuss type of traveler who does not need anything other than a clean and quiet place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “No more than a 3 star.. stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: nadineLondon
Reviews.Content: Of the 15+ hotels we've stayed in, in London this summer - this unfortunately was the worst. Extremely small and cramped rooms, pigeon views only, unmade room, missing furniture, off milk - all of it, unstocked fridge, missing robes and slippers, once bottle of small water for a double room 'complimentary', all old & broken appliances, odd smell throughout the hotel - room worse, security problems.. There is nothing superior, deluxe or 5 star about this hotel. Sheratons, Hiltons and even Holidays Inns are a better bet than staying at a Grange = go with these instead.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 'Mystery Hotel'”
Reviews.Author: PaulaBev
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights here, and thoroughly enjoyed the stay. Booked via lastminute.com 'mystery hotel' and was not dissapointed. Hotel is extremely well located to various transport links including the Thames clipper service. Additionally just a stones throw from Tower of London, Tower Bridge and St Katherines Dock. Venture across the river to Butlers Wharf for a nice meal by the river, or wander along to the South Bank for more culinery options. Lots of lively pubs, cocktail bars within a very short walking distance, these are very busy Monday to Friday lunchtimes and evenings with the city workers, with the pace slowing at the weekend. Checking in and concierge staff very friendly and efficient, and great at getting a cab! There is a female friendly wing on the seventh floor, with also the option of a select few smoking rooms. Housekeeping service excellent, and room service the quickest I have experienced. The bar and lounge are very comfortable, nice supply of free canopes supplied early evening. Would recommend using this as an alternative central location in London to anyone visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: ozkan1980
Reviews.Content: This is a business hotel, but has a bit more character. It is 5* standards, with good amneties, good restaurant, nice rooms but best of all is the spa centre. The gym is small but never too busy, but the roman style swimming pool is fantastic with steam room, saune and jacuzzi. We stayed in over the weekend where the price on Fridays and Saturdays goes down to half price with same 5* luxuries. Only down side is the food isn't great but it's by Tower of London with plenty of options. Well worth the stay

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable and great location”
Reviews.Author: kbuk
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to this hotel and again was quite pleased with it. The rooms are of a good size, the decor is good, and it is very clean. It offers free wi-fi, just ask at the front desk. The continental breakfast is also excellent with a lot of variety - and you can opt to have cooked breakfast for a charge. The location is one of the great things about this hotel. It is right outside the Tower Hill station within easy access to major sights and a quick stroll to the Thames and the tower bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great view”
Reviews.Author: Jasper V
Reviews.Content: Booked this as a mystery hotel, was very pleased with the outcome: nice room, very comfortable beds and even a sort of balcony, with a view of the Tower Bridge. Bathroom and wardrobe were a bit on the small size, but still good enough for the weekend. Staff of the hotel was very helpful with any queries, concierge provided good service by having umbrella's for guest to cope with the typical London summer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: FRENCHIEEastSussex
Reviews.Content: My favourite hotel in London!! It's a real pleasure to stay there from relaxing in pool,having a sauna to enjoying a great meal at their restaurant.The room are comfortable,I was lucky enough last time I was there to be upgraded.The room was fantastic with it's floor to ceiling window and it's little loundge area. It's just a great hotel with very friendly and efficient staff.I so look forwards to go back in the very near future.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, pleasant hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Runcible_7_8
Reviews.Content: Firstly, it's right next door to a Tube station and therefore getting back to base in the evening or after the cricket match we had come to London to see was very straightforward. Elegant marble foyer and very helpful, pleasant receptionists and concierge / baggage clerk - really couldn't do enough to help. Pleasant rooms in woods, creams, leather; well appointed, flat screen TV and smart little bathroom with usual toiletries. Excellent view from floor to ceiling window, out over the city and with a good wedge of the Tower of London to see too. Free paper in the morning. Breakfast was really very good for a throw-in - fresh fruits, yogurts, meats and cheeses, boiled eggs, toast, Danish pastries, jam and marmalade, croissants, 5 juices - pity about the usual hotel coffee but great otherwise. The micro-area it's located in is very pleasant with a cobbled street, a fine Baroque church, gardens a short way off, the river, and hardly any traffic. At the back is an ancient Roman wall with interesting boards explaining the history of it - and you are literally moments from the Tower of London too. A few minutes further on, and you can take a boat up the Thames to the London Eye - nice way to start the day. Really liked it and assuming we can get a decent deal, we will return. There's a nice-looking swimming pool, free wi-fi, magazines, fresh fruit in the room - all sorts of nice little extras which you won't find in the Travel Inn. Only downside - plug in bath didn't seem to work and husband had to jam his heel in it to keep his water levels up ! Not a big problem ..

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Presuminged
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel. the beds are comfortable, the rooms clean and of a good size. Continental breakfast was also very good. At night there was no noise from planes,cars,sirens,revellers at all which in my experience is rare for London. The hotel is on a very quiet street yet only 50m from tube station and 5 Min walk from Tower of London. We stayed on a weekend and there were more than a few hen parties booking in to the hotel, though I have to say they were no trouble. Would certainly consider using this hotel (or other Grange hotels) in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dunney_87
Reviews.Content: We had a slight delay with check-in, however this was a problem with the bank and the credit card. The receptionist could not stop apologising even though it was not her fault. The rooms were very nice, a little on the small side if anything, but we were not there to spend the weekend in a hotel room. The bathroom was huge and the shower excellent. The hotel staff in general were extremely helpful and polite. The hotel is located no more than a 2 minute walk to the nearest tube station, very easy for getting in and out of the city. I will definitely be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsCupcake02
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a large groups of friends on a girlie weekend. Staff are really helpful, one of our rooms was not ready in time, because of this we were offered as a group late check out the next day and a bottle of wine sent up to the room . I understand this may have been a problem if there was just one room needed however, we were grateful of the offer. The rooms were all clean, all spacious and the quad rooms also had a pull down bed in them so could sleep up to six. The breakfast was continental, restuaraunt clean and no limit on what you could eat. The reason for the 4 rating rather than 5 is that the hotel bar is very expensive (we found a Wetherspoons bar not far away) Also, all the staff we encountered did not speak English as a first language and on a couple of occassions this did cause problems. However, all in all I would definately stay at this hotel again.Oh, and it's a fab location!

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: ladyprufrock_10
Reviews.Content: Despite my misgivings regarding standard of service here (3rd or 4th stay) decided to stay here for the steam room... bad decision. The room was big, but old - bathroom plug needed to be pulled out to drain the bath and the sink is slow to drain. Towels smelled of vinegar and shower door didn't close properly either - not what you expect from so called 5 star hotel. For me most importantly at the check in I was asked whether I wanted a newspaper and requested FT - which then was duly charged to my room at 2 pounds per day. I wasn't told that this would be charged to the room and assumed it will be complementary as they were available in the lobby. Not a big deal but really I should have been told. Also we stayed from Tuesday to Friday and when asked for late check out they offered an hour (!!) extension. This is a mostly business hotel with special rates for the weekend to prop up occupancy. After almost full week of stay surely they can offer better than 12 pm check out rather than 11 am. There are three other hotels right next to the Grange, one of which is practically brand new, but the Grange seems to think that they can treat their customers like commodities. I stayed in Apex around the same number of times, and when I check in there they give me early check in and says "welcome back". Small things perhaps, but given how indifferent the Grange staff is, I determined that the steam room that I manage to go perhaps once during my stay is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyable trip - rooms overlooking Tower Bridge are excellent!”
Reviews.Author: baggers21
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long week end trip to London staying at the Grange City Hotel. All in all an excellent hotel with first class service. The Rooms: Before arriving at the hotel I contacted the hotel to ask for a room on a high floor overlooking Tower Bridge and Zane from Guest Relations was excellent in sorting this out for our special stay. The room size is good, and the bathroom size is average. The rooms had a lot of storage space and the view was to die for. A nice touch was the fruit bowl on arrival and also that each day the maids came and cleaned the room but then early evening they come back again to put chocolates and the breakfast menu out on the pillows and also to give you fresh towels. The only slight gripe I had with the bathroom was that the water was warm but not hot from the bath or shower - this was a bit disappointing for a 5* hotel. The Staff: All the staff were very friendly especially the staff on the concierge service desk. We opted not to have breakfast as we thought this was expensive and there are better value for money options avaliable locally.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: natsdad2000
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as we were in London for the weekend as a birthday treat for my Wifes 40th birthday. It is literally 20 seconds from Tower Hill Tube station and central London is at most 15-20 mins on the Tube. On checking in we were upgraded to an executive room and had views of the Thames and the Tower. The room was comfortble, with a Queen size bed and all the amenities that you would expect from a 5* hotel. Breakfast consisted of a continental Buffet, with croissants, toast , cereals, boiled eggs, fresh fruit, hams and cheeses.....more than enough to fill you up and get you ready for the day. The hotel comes with a Spa, swimming pool and health club, but unfortunately didnt have time to get down there and try it out. Outside the hotel, within 5 mins walk there are numerous pubs and restaurants of good value and I would reccomend the Cheshire Cheese and the Friars Crutch. All in all, a fantastic hotel, well worth the money and I am already looking forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Countryman1
Reviews.Content: The room had a great view out over London, the room was clean tidy and very comfortable. The Hotel amenities where great with swimming pool, Jacuzzi, sauna, steam room and a great massage. I cant fault this hotel, well done guys and girls for making us so welcome.

Reviews.Title: “A varied weekend”
Reviews.Author: Nickjones999
Reviews.Content: This weekend I booked three rooms ...night one I was staying with a friend m, we had a lovely twin room, very clean and had an amazing view of the tower... On the Saturday I had booked two rooms, one for my partner and I, and the other for a couple... I expected changing rooms could be a pain, but this was done with ease and the staff made the weekend a brilliant experience looking after all our needs. Zane was particularly helpful! The swimming pool was great and breakfast lovely! A wonderful hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: thewallsonvacation
Reviews.Content: Stay: One night 25 June 2011 We stayed at this hotel for a big black tie event at The Guildhall and found it to be very pleasant - clean and very friendly staff. We were upgraded to a small suite (room 901) which had a fantastic view of the Tower of London and most of London. Big comfortable bed. Bathroom was small but all new and very clean - lovely toiletries too. Drinks were not cheap but it is London. Good choice of breakfast - would definitely stay again if we needed a room in London and literally 30 seconds from Fenchurch Street station.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and clean room”
Reviews.Author: Gemma P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband to be close to a work do. We booked far in advance to get the best rates which made this worthwhile. The room was small but very clean and quiet. Our window looked onto Fenchurch Street Station but they must have tripple glazing at we did not hear a thing from outside! Very comfortable bed, great toiletries and tea cofee facilities. Only small gripe would be there is no clear queing for the check and check out so people are jumping in when others have been waiting quite a while, the hotel needs to have a better system for this as it was very frustrating. Overall we will definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, like all London hotels, otherwise not too bad”
Reviews.Author: YBOD98
Reviews.Content: PRICE has always got to be a big factor, but all London hotels cost a pocket. We shopped round and got a fair deal on this one, but still pretty eye watering by any standard. The place itself in various stays has always been clean and efficient. The rooms are highly variable from dark and low overlooking the station to high and bright looking towards Tower Bridge, if you can get to pre-select a room I suggest you do so, the higher the better. That said I have stayed here and overlooked the station, as it was a business trip it didn't matter that much. The breakfasts are good but expensive, around Â£20. If you can jsut afford to stay here but need to save a few pounds I suggest you go out. Liewise I have not had dinner here, there are so many good eateries nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value London Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hershey30
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed in the City before, prefering the west end. I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel; staff keen to deliver good service and some excellent rooms. It is convenient for many things for me. Breakfast though was underwhelming

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel next to the Thames and overlooking Tower Bridge”
Reviews.Author: AussieLawyer29
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel in a great location and in a fabulous city. I stayed at the Grange City for 4 nights. It certainly wasn't cheap but then again London is not cheap and it's difficult to find really good accommodation for under 200 pounds a night. Whilst it was a little on the expensive side it is in a fantastic location. The hotel room itself had a view directly out onto London Tower and Tower Bridge. I was never at any stage bored with the location as it's 50 meters from the Tower Hill tube station, 100 meters (or so) to the Thames, 300 meters to Tower Bridge and maybe .8 km to London Bridge. Get yourself a daily tube ticket and use it to your heart's content. Every major tourist attraction and sight is virtually a 10 minutes train ride away. The hotel's food was ok. I had room service a couple of nights and ate the salmon. That was reasonably price at 16 pounds. There are loads of bars and restaurants nearby. The hotel has a great gym and indoor pool, although I chose to go outdoors running along the Thames and found one of the Fitness First gyms I am a member of. There are lots of these in London, so if you are a Fitness First member don't forget to take your membership card and international passport (FF passport). The rooms in the hotel are big and a huge Kind size bed was a welcome sight at the end of the day. The bed was extremely comfortable. There is a sofa and a large TV in the room which is hooked up to cable with a choice of something like 50 plus stations. If you are like me... I was happy to watch EPL and other soccer matches as it was play-off time. This is a great hotel and one which I would highly recommend to business travellers and tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view, very nice room”
Reviews.Author: MassMommy
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here in mid April - the view was of the Tower of London and London Bridge - the best view I could imagine. Our room was very nice - and included a very comfortable cot/bed set up by the big window for our younger daughter. We had no complaints about the room - the only things we'd change would be to increase the efficiency of the reception desk and to have the hot tub working (it was out during our stay). The staff was helpful once you got them, but the check-in, check-out situation did take too long. The City area is pretty quiet on weekends - but location worked out fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special - for a 5* hotel I wouldn't bother with this one again”
Reviews.Author: bint86
Reviews.Content: Service Good service however just after we arrived it became very busy at reception and there is no organised queueing system which left people confused and not sure where to go. Same goes for the luggage storage, it all seemed a bit dis-organised. Room When asked whether we wanted a smoking or non-smoking room I asked for the one with the best view. As there none left available we were given a free upgrade to an executive room. I'm glad we were upgrading as the room was smaller than basic Travelodge/Premier Inn rooms so I dread to think how small the others were. The room overlooked Fenchurch Street station which wasn't so bad but there were a lot of office windows looking directly into our room so we kept our curtains closed - shame as it was gorgeous weekend so the sun in the morning would have been nice. Location Literally 30 seconds from Tower Bridge underground and just across the road from the Tower of London but that's it. We walked back from Southwark/Embankment 1 night at a gentle stroll and it took at least 45 mins. Amenities Spa was nice though you feel like you're intruding on the staff and that you should know exactly where you're going and what you should be doing. Pool was too cold so spent all my time in the jacuzzi! Room service took ages (over 1 hour for 2 meals) and we had to ring to see where our food was a couple of times. We ordered Pizza (which you could tell was not fresh and tasted very cheap) and spaghetti bolognese (very bland with cold sticky pasta by the time it arrived). Breakfast Very impersonal, took ages for tea and coffee to be done so much so we gave up and had drinks in our room. Food was OK. To be honest for a 5* hotel in London it's not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great experience”
Reviews.Author: kvbanga
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two days in April after the Royal Wedding rush. London was really busy and exciting at this time. But Grange was a peaceful haven for us. We had our 2 year old with us and he was hyper but the staff was really helpful in getting everything set for us. We did not go to the restaurant but the lounge bar & cafe was a godsend for us. They helped us with the morning milk for my son and coffees for us and they brought it to our room as i didnt have any hands free with my runner of a son with me. The room service food was also really great. After a day of sightseeing we didnt feel like traipsing our again. So room service it was and very tasty. We will definitely go back. I already recommended it to my friend and one of them has already been there. A special mention for the conceirge and bellman. Very helpful. They got us tickets to all the touristy places and also recommended witherspoons a great breakfast fast place which is a couple of minutes walk..

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: h0peful75
Reviews.Content: I can't say that I will ever stay here again. The reception staff are rude, unhelpful and couldn't really care less, which is not a good front for the hotel. The rooms are fine, with nice beds, but mine on the 3rd floor was dingy and overlooked the fenchucrch st station platform directly which was odd. A member of staff just walked directly into the room to replace the water, saying he didn't think anyone was in the rooms at this time even though it was 2.30pm and check in is at 2pm, luckily I was dressed. They then started room maintenence in the room next door at 8am the following morning, which was very noisy and even made my bed move as they were banging on the walls. I told the receptionist of this and she didn't really care. Breakfast was way too expensive at Â£23 pp so we went round the corner to one of the other hotels. Also be aware that most things are shut in the city at the weekend. The hotel was also full of hen nights that spent their time running up and down the corriders. There was at least 2 groups of 20 hen weekenders checking in when i did. I must say though the spa was nice and the therapist I had was very profesional. I would not recommend this, not if you want a relxing break or a decent nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Kate_t51
Reviews.Content: We booked this through the secret rooms function on LastMinute.com, and got a brilliant hotel for a fantatic price. The hotel is right next door to the tube station, which makes it really convienient to get to and from. The check in process was easy and the staff friendly. I arrived just after work so myself and a number of ther people were trying to check in at the same time. I agree with other reviews that it could do with some kind of organisation to stop people jumping ahead of each other, but everything was calm and well handled and I only had to wait about 5 min. We had a room on the 9th floor, which was great. Not much of a view (office and railway) but the blinds worked well and the room size was fantastic, enough space to have a bed, a sofa, a desk and a couple of chairs and still be able to move around! The room felt clean and comfortable, although some of the chrome items in the bathroom were slighty scuffed and the air con was slightly noisy. Neither of these things spoilt our stay in the slightest, but maybe if I had paid full price??

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: non-stop-orb
Reviews.Content: The check in process is so slow. We waited ages to book in and the room wasn't ready. We then waited another 15 -20 mins just to hand our luggage over. We came back late in the afternoon and found they hadn't taken our bag to the room as they said they would. Overall the hotel is good, comfortable and clean. Some areas of the bathroom could do with attention, as the fittings are chrome and tarnished in places. There were also some marks on the tiles around the bath area and under the sink. There was also some kind of stain on the underside of the tap. The wine glasses were coated in dust, and the mini fridge had pressure sensors, so anything you moved in the fridge, even if you put it back was charged directly to your bill. Meaning you cant use it to store your own items. There are ice machines on some floors which are very handy for drinks. The air con unit was effective in controlling the room temperature. The hotel is ideally located for visits to Tower Bridge, Tower of London and right next to the tube. Plenty of bars and restaurants all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: Highstandardsplease
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights recently. Overall good experience although breakfast as others have noted was poor. The hotel also is a little too far away from the main tourist areas which means a very long walk or long tube journeys. However the bedroom which had a great view of the tower of London was quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Cher020
Reviews.Content: I would not range it 5 stars. The bathroom seemed old, the breakfast was not worth the money at all. And I ended up having me jacket stolen from my hotel room. So my experience is negative and I won't return there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheBluetac
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the weekend of 20th May 2011 for two nights. The hotel itself is very handy to Tower Hill tube and being in the City of London it is in a quiet enough area. Staff were courteous, polite and professional. Room was fantastic, but the Swimming pool/Spa facilities were absolutely second to none! Could not find fault with this fantastic hotel. Will hopefully be staying again. Totally recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: davidjones533
Reviews.Content: This is one of the many business hotels in London that rent out their rooms over the weekend at greatly reduced prices. At this reduced rate we were not disappointed - the room and bathroom were large, clean and quiet. Being close to the City, many of the local bars and restaurants were closed over the weekend, but nothing a quick trip on the tube can't fix. It is not a five-star hotel in terms of luxury, only on its facilities, and is no different to many other business hotels that I have stayed in. However, considering the lowered weekend price, especially when compared to budget hotels in less desirables areas, it is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “would happily return”
Reviews.Author: greyhorses
Reviews.Content: easy to reach - just a very short walk from the tube - comfortable room and lovely pool and spa facilities for a central London hotel. Didn't pay the extra for a full cooked breakfast and pleased we didn't as the continental was lovely and plenty of choice. Check in need to be improved though as a little tedious - lots of staff standing there but not knowing what to do!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel - just not a great one :(”
Reviews.Author: simonp820
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in May as the Grange St Paul's (where I would normally stay) was fully booked. Agree with other comments about snotty staff. Asked to check in early and was given an absolute 'no' without any effort to check for me. The air con in the first room I was given didn't work and trying to get it fixed at 11pm (when I returned in the evening) was hard work. I eventually had to move rooms - allbeit to a suite. Rooms are rather dated and don't have the feel of the Grange St Pauls which is much more modern. Breakfast was VERY expensive (Â£23 for continental) - Internet was free but via signup which was crazy complicated. The location is great for the City/Tower of London and there's a tube station 100m away - sadly, it and the entire circle line was closed for the whole weekend which meant a 15-20 minute walk to Bank Station. Not the hotel's fault I guess. Overall - average stay. Not a bad a hotel really - just not a great one :(

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: mkk_8
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a top secret hotel on Lastminute.ie. We stayed for 3 nights over the Easter weekend. The staff were lovely and the very helpful doorman directed us to an underground carpark a 5 minute walk from the hotel as there is very limited parking at the hotel itself. Check in was quick and easy. I was slightly disappointed with the room as it was quite small and dark. It was on a low floor and just level with a railway track beside the hotel. It was just a pity to be in such a dark room on what was a glorious weekend weatherwise so it is probably a good idea to request a higher room. Having said that the room was clean, very quiet, had plenty storage and all the facilities you would want and the shower was the most powerful one that I have ever used. I found the bed to be too soft but that is just personal preference. I used the gym and swimming pool during the stay and was impressed with both. Great variety of exercise machines with a seperate room for free weights. The pool is big and ideal if you like to do more than splash around. Some of the rooms are located in a seperate wing with no direct access to the leisure area without walking through the lobby so it is worth requesting a room near the leisure centre if like me you like to use the gym and then go back to the room to shower. The hotel is ideally located if like us you were in London as tourists. Tower Hill tube station is right next to the hotel as are the Tower of London and London Bridge. A quick trip on the tube will bring you anywhere else you want to go. Be aware of the fact that Westminster Abbey and St Paul's Cathedral only open for half days on Saturdays and are closed on Sundays to allow for services. London is a great city with loads of see and do, more than we could fit in the 3 days we were there. We will definately be back and would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for business, but bad service”
Reviews.Author: irbflyfish
Reviews.Content: Typical of London hotels, very small rooms, some overlooking the train station, so avoid those rooms. But it is a great location for business, and is next to the Tower of London.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: vix186411
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I stayed at the Grange City Hotel as I was attending an awards ceremony at the Museum of London nearby. We had booked the hotel via Secret Hotels and were impressed from the offset. It is a stunning building with incredible facilities from a large swimming pool to a spa and sauna. The service was first rate from the moment one enters to when you leave and we were given a huge suite that was the size of a small house! All the staff went above and beyond to ensure their guests were happy. The room service and restaurant food was also superb and coming from a family of restauranteurs, I know good food! I would wholeheartedly recommend staying at this most wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: merycox
Reviews.Content: It was an awesome experience staying at this hotel after a pathetic stay at some hotel I stayed last time. Grange City is outstandingly fantastic to have a leisure stay in the core of the city. Moreover, the friendly staff played a great role in this. I got it booked through one of the new websites called ukhotels4u.com through their Secret Hotel mode.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not 5 star service at all”
Reviews.Author: KellyParker
Reviews.Content: Great location if you are working in the City or want to be near St Paul's and near the river. I can't fault the location at all. The room was a good size, though the bathroom amenities were very basic, and what I'd expect to find in 3 or 4 star hotels. The lobby and building itself are very modern and sleek. The blackout linings to the curtains meant a nice, quiet, dark nights sleep. What lets the hotel down entirely is the service. I was there on a Sunday night. We started calling for room service at 9pm. No reply after 25 rings to room service. 10 rings before reception picked up, and when they did, they said they were busy but would call back. They didn't. We tried room service again, and no one picked up again . We tried reception and they took our order . 2 sandwiches and 2 cokes took over 1 hour to arrive and when they did, the hot sandwiches and chips were cold and the cold drinks were warm (we had asked for ice for the drinks, but none came). So after 90 minutes, we got food which was barely edible. This is not 5 star service, it's barely 3 star! I really wanted to like this hotel, it was my first stay there, but I won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Stunning”
Reviews.Author: WestWalesHorse
Reviews.Content: Booked a last minute weekend break to celebrate our wedding anniversary. It was a "secret Hotel" with lastminute.com so prepared to take a chance. Imagine my surprise when the delightful young lady on reception upgraded us to an executive suit on the 11th floor which had the most drop dead view of the Tower of London and Tower bridge which just simply took our breath away.......and guess what......it cost me Â£90. Oh - nearly forgot - its got a spa and a 25meter swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Scottishgirls_9
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful weekend at the the Grange City Hotel whilst celebrating my neice's 16th Birthday. We had great views. The rooms are spacious very clean with comfortable beds. The hotel is in a great location for seeing the sites. The weather was lovely so we enjoyed taking the boat trips into central London. We all enjoyed an early morning swim and breakfast. Fun weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - definetely not a 5 star though”
Reviews.Author: benjmatty
Reviews.Content: I looked forward to staying in a 5 star hotel which looked very posh on the ground floor and in the reception area, however when going in my room i was disappointed. The room was small and like any other hotel room, nothing very special or unique about it and definetely not worth the money paid. Very clean and beautiful spa and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star but great location and pretty good all the same”
Reviews.Author: matbend
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2011. The hotel has that '90's opulent' feel. Staff were nice, the rooms are a decent size with a large bed, sofa and about ten pillows. The rooms are also quiet which was a good job as ours faced directly on to Platform 4 of Fenchurch St Station...This didn't bother us as we we're only there for one night. Definitely worth the Â£100 a night last min deal we got. Bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel, great location and a bargain price”
Reviews.Author: GaryHLondon
Reviews.Content: Overview and bargain price This is the second time we've stayed at this hotel and it really is a great hotel. Although it is classed as five star it is not in the same league as The Ritz or the Savoy but the price is also not in the same league - so what do you expect. You can get some really good bargains here so check out the deals before booking. Location It is in a great location, just around the corner from Tower Hill tube station - so you can get anywhere in London on the tube, but it is miles away from the tacky touristy parts of west London. You could also pop around the corner to Fenchurch Street Station and have a day out at the seaside in Southend -on-Sea if you fancy a change from city life. Staff Staff are friendly and helpful although check in/check out can be slow. A special mention for the the concierge who was very helpful. Rooms The rooms are large and well decorated (lots of photos on tripadvisor) but don't have the supersize plasma screens (but do have a BOSE wave) but why would you want to watch TV when you're in London? Bathrooms are a bit on the small side. Some rooms overlook the train station so if you expect a view of the Tower of London you maybe disappointed - Ask if you want a view of ToL. Even though the rooms overlook the train station they are still reasonably quiet. Breakfast/Restaurants/Bar Breakfast is good, the usual all you can eat/self service buffet fare and cooked full English - I really wouldn't bother paying extra for the cooked breakfast. I didn't visit the restaurants as I tend to steer clear of hotel restaurants - much better to try one of the local restaurants - butlers wharf has plenty of choice and it just over the bridge. The hotel bar is OK, as usual slightly overpriced so if you fancy a drink just pop around the corner to the Wetherspoons pub. Overall a top hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Location - Not a 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hattie88_11
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Last Minute for a really good price and after reading the description were really looking forward to a 5 star night in London. The location is fantastic, a minute walk from the tube station and a two minute walk to the Tower of London. Our check in was ok, very busy when we arrived, although no-one showed us to our room or offered to take our luggage,we were waved in the general direction of the lift to our floor. The room was very clean and spacious, on our booking confirmation it said that an ipod docking staion would be one of the ammenities, there was only a cd player and radio. The Molton Brown toiletries are lovely and the thickly glazed windows are fantastic for keeping the noisy London traffic out, so we did sleep wonderfully. We ordered room service late in the evening, and the food left a lot to be desired, my pizza looked and tasted as though it was frozen and had come from Iceland, not worth the Â£13.50 by any means. Based on our room service food we decided to pass on breakfast which was priced at Â£23.00 each! Another reason we chose this hotel was because of the spa, the pictures on the website were beautiful and I couldn't wait to relax before we went out for supper. We had no robes in our room so called down to the spa to ask if they were provided, I was told rather sternly 'we have towels and locker keys'! We did not time our trip to the spa well, as we arrived a large group of loud women on a hen party arrived, greatly disturbing the quiet. Even in the steam room you could her them at the other end of the pool, complete disregard for people trying to swim or relax. The steam room was dirty with a nasty greenish stain on the floor and it had far too much eucalyptus fragance in; stinging both mine and my partners eyes and I could taste it in my throat for a good time after. The sauna was old and tired, with bits of newspaper all over and a big stain on the floor. We decided to end our spa trip after only 15 minutes and as we left the spa a rather rude employee pushed through the doors as I opened them, knocking into me with no appology. Our check out was slow, with just two receptionist it was obvious why, however the receptionist was very friendly and could not be faulted. The concierge service worked well and the hotel will store your luggage for you after check out should you wish to explore London. The hotel would have been greatly overpriced had we payed full rate, however with the late deal we got it was fine for what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Makena07
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable, with spacious rooms for European standards. It's location is perfect for business, though it can get quiet at night with little night life or amenities nearby. While the Tower of London is close, there is a surprising lack of restaurants or eateries nearby. It is short cab ride to Knightsbridge or Oxford, and a good walk to most attractions. Beds were extremely comfortable. Any slight criticisms: telephone keypads were not clean (nor was the remote control - are they ever?), television was low definition, hair dryer was awful, and the clothes closet had an odd smell-with a pants press but no iron. Room service was acceptable but they didnt remove the trays promptly. Most of the chamber staff do not speak English (dont ask for more towels or say more than hello), and the breakfast buffet staff were friendly and earnest, but if you deviated from the "normal script" in any way, their language and service shortcomings quickly revealed.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: hauschka888
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay in Grange city hotel in January, the best thing about this hotel is its location, very close to the metro station & tower bridge, the room is clean but I would not consider it as 5 star, free wi-fi which is very nice. The discount rate they are offering in winter is what it values for I would say.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed - would LOVE to go back”
Reviews.Author: Zarz1234
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. I have stayed at many hotels of a similar rating in my time, and have sometimes been disappointed wondering how they managed to be classified as being 5*. Grange City, however was exactly the standard I had hoped for. The staff were so incredibly friendly and willing to deal with my requests and queries. We rang several times; we had a problem with the blinds which was resolved immediately and they were very apologetic, we were unable to work out how to run the bath (it isn't at all obvious - perhaps they should have included it in the guest information pack) but they were very helpful with that also. I could not have asked for more from a hotel. The pool and spa were delightful - just like the photos (unlike some hotels). I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donnellap
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights - bed was lovely but room a bit small, free internet in room sbut have to log in with details each time you want to use it. Concierge gave us toothpaste and shoe polish upon request. Breakfast was grand - more than enough choice - small teaspoons a bit hard to find. also on the 4th floor there was a smell of food cooking at the end of the corridor. Gym was good too - did not have swimsuit to try pool. Location good - no free parking nearby though. Shame the restaurant was not open weekends - missed a great sushi offer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location but totally overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: dee186600
Reviews.Content: Simple continental breakfast cost Â£23 per person, regardless of what you consumed. Had a slice of brie, half a slice of (hard) bread and a coffee and it cost Â£23! Will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: businestraveler100
Reviews.Content: Due to a blizzard in the US, my flight was canceled and I called to cancel after the cancellation cut off (which is 24 hours before the day of rather than 24 hours before the 2pm check in time). I asked for a cancellation and spoke to 3 people who did nothing but parrot the policy and then called back for the headoffice and asked for a manager but spoke to someone who told me to write an email and then hung up.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: KimboBimbo
Reviews.Content: Was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel in terms of location and quality. There was a short delay in getting us checked in (early too as was only 1pm) due to an issue with the reservation system. This was not an issue for us at all however we received a complimentary upgrade due to the short wait. The room had a fantastic view over Tower Bridge with a gigantic bed and lovely bathroom with Molton Brown toiletries. Room spotless. Only downsides - TV wasn't best quality and kept turning itself off, the heating struggled to get past room tempaerature and the noise insulation from room to room was very poor (we heard next door's alarm clock!). Other than this this it was fantastic, with a great location 1 min walk from tube on Circle and District line. My only advice would be book through a 3rd party booking agent e.g. lastminute.com to get a better deal. We booked 3 months in advance and got the room for Â£100 each night however a elderly man we met in the lift was quite upset as he had paid Â£180 a night through hotel and said everyone he spoke to had done the same as us and got it much cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Well sited hotel with excellent pool”
Reviews.Author: Kompo
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel with Lastminute.com Top Secret and was very pleased overall with this 5* hotel in a great position. Although we had reserved a 'superior' quality room, we were disappointed to find we had only a view of a very close brick wall, and no sofa or second bed - we did not feel this was really a 'superior' quality room, although all the fittings and bed were obviously top quality. We did check with reception (who did not answer the phone - we had to go back to reception in person), but were told that yes, this was a 'superior' room. Had I paid more than lastminute rates I would have been very annoyed. On a room-only basis, and having read previous reviews, we decided to pass on breakfast in the hotel, so cannot comment. Finishing on a high note, we loved the 25m swimming pool and steam room - superb facilities in a city-centre hotel which we much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable... Not Dripping in Luxury Though”
Reviews.Author: hazaholic
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a comfortable stay at the hotel. We travelled by car, managed to get parked in the hotel parking area and wanted to go on foot to the hotel... We only had a small map and it took us 20 minutes what should have been a 2 minute walk, be warned and know where to go! On arrival, we queued at reception for about 10 minutes and then checked in, the reception desk is always busy. We then went to the bistro at 2PM for some lunch. It was empty, and we had to ask the guy behind the bar if we wanted something, he wouldn't come and ask. We then went to our room, a good size with good TV channels, and a comfortable bed and nice bathroom, with a bath, toilet - nothing spectacular. On our stay the hotel was having problems and the internet was down, so I phoned the concierge who allowed me to use the executive room computers. I stupidly left my laptop in there, however spoke to the concierge who brought it to my room which was a nice touch. All in all a good stay, I would recommend it. It isn't as expensive as The Dorchester but there is a reason why, it isn't as luxurious, but still a very nice hotel - It's the hotel you find miss-average visiting with her daughter for lunch who comes in and says blimey its amazing - but not if you are used to 5*s, and the main stayers are Polish businessmen.

Reviews.Title: “Good city location and a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: EnglishmaninParis
Reviews.Content: Perfect if you work around Fenchurch Street and the hotel is a pleasant surprise and probably the nicest hotel I have stayed in around this area (I paid a lot more to stay in The Guoman Tower and although much larger had the tiniest room ever!). Was given a large room with comfortable king-size bed and a reasonable seating area which was furnished well. Staff are helpful and I would recommend this to anyone who needs somewhere to stay a few days and wants to be in the City.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but most basic level of 5star.”
Reviews.Author: PompeyStuart
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, but the cheap price is fairly reflective of what you get. I don't know how hotel ratings are achieved, but i'd imagine this one meets the most basic criteria for being a 5star hotel. Nothing special, but good value for the price. The pool and gym area were very nice and welcoming. Only complaint would be breakfast, we had to wait 20 minutes for a table, given the small size of the restaurant, plus most of the buffet was starting to run out. A big benefit is the location, literally only 100mtrs from Tube and 50mtrs from Fenchurch Street railway.

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel, ideal for business rather than pleasure”
Reviews.Author: jameswilliams681
Reviews.Content: As we've come to expect from Grange hotels, this hotel was smart and comfortable. Located in the city therefore probably better for business trips rather than leisure. However good overall hotel. Really nice swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off London”
Reviews.Author: MrNL
Reviews.Content: I don't stay in London too often but am constantly amazed that 3* hotels can suggest on their sites 5* status. So, Â£120 for a room with continental breakfast for one night. Â£120 !!! For an extra sum they would even offer a breakfast consisting of more than the continental buffet of hard boiled (to the point of extinction) eggs, cheap cheese and something which once resembled meat. A few dosdny looking coissants and poor chouice of cereal, All washed down with tea which had never seen a tea bag, served by staff who do their utmost to avoid eye contact. Perharps I caught this on a bad day ? Perhaps but I doubt it London hotels are generally accepted as being poor - why this is acceptable I don't know. Anywhere else in the country, one would value this stay at about Â£50 for a night ( inc a full breakfast). This is in no way a 5* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find”
Reviews.Author: JSS55
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, right by the Tower of London and so easy to get to/from The O2 for concerts. Fantastic room, breakfast, leisure facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: CollyColin
Reviews.Content: Should have been a lovely hotel but fell short of a 5* - our view was of the London Undeground. Felt like a goldfish bowl and could hear everything. Great if you want to see people get on and off trains all day. Bathroom could have been a little cleaner but not too bad but if you were elderly or have mobility problems you would never be able to get into the bath/shower and when you did you would have to be so careful of slipping when you get out. Bar small especially when busy on an evening, drinks London prices, breakfast ok ish (more a holiday inn style) but an extra Â£8 for a cooked one!! If your going to pay these prices go for the Hilton - far better

Reviews.Title: “Spoiled by bean-counting and bureaucracy.”
Reviews.Author: JohnMMMfromDevon
Reviews.Content: I stepped out of the Underground and was delighted to find myself at the hotel within a few paces. Good! The lobby was cramped and I found myself in a queue. Eventually I found my room. It was OK - wood-panneling and adequate equipment. The iron in the room (non-steam) was dreadful. However, the Concierge rustled up a Housekeeping steam iron very quickly and my dress shirt was pressed in no time. So, fast-forward to the end of the evening. Returned from a posh party to weak cocktails and cramped bars. Very expensive. BUT! What killed this hotel for me was the disgraceful mugging of guests as they made their way to breakfast. Clearly this hotel has inadequate seating at breakfast and to have to QUEUE at a 5* hotel. Pathetic. The reason for the queueing? An officious employee trying to mug guests to upgrade from Continental breakfast to full English (for Â£8.00). WHAT?!!! We all felt extremely uncomfortable about this. Once in the cramped room, self-service all the way. No toast, no coffee or tea. Aimless employees wandering around with coffee and tea jugs failed to see me or any of our party. I ended up grabbing a jug and serving myself. Utterly disgraceful. Order for breakfast wrong; eggs Benedict disgusting. I will not be returning and I will gladly advise caution when considering staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, great for a business traveller”
Reviews.Author: miss_v_rose
Reviews.Content: I was in double executive room on the 11th floor as part of a work trip. I checked-in early and found the conceirge staff were very attentive. The staff at this hotel are very friendly and always say hello when they walk past you. My room was fantastic, it was very spacious and had a very decent sized bathroom. The room and bathroom were clean and the shower was great. Shower caps, cotton balls, shampoo, conditioner etc were all provided. There was a flat screen tv as well as a good selection of magazines in the room. There were floor to ceiling windows and the location was very quiet at night. There is an awesome view of the Tower of London from the lift well. The food at the hotel was actually quite impressive. The buffet breakfast was really good although very expensive at 23 pounds. The food in ISIS Bar was also good and the servings were large. I would definitely recommend this hotel for business travellers who want to be close to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & View.”
Reviews.Author: Dramaman_10
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with an amazing view of The Tower of London from our room. Friendly staff and a splendid breakfast, make this an excellent base for business and leisure use. Tube and bus links are right outside making travelling easy.

Reviews.Title: “Despite modern upgrades, good for location - will book again!”
Reviews.Author: StonehurstPlaceInn
Reviews.Content: This is the second time for me at the Grange City Hotel, just steps away from the Tower Hill tube station. Both times we've been in Room 312, a suite with separate living room, work desk, and windows opening over Cooper's Row. Lean your head just right and you can see the Tower of London! I can't imagine that all rooms at the Grange are as large as this suite we had. GBP300 weekday. The room obviously hasn't been refurbished in a while; nothing wrong, just not so contemporary as you find these days. We often/usually stay at the Andaz but when they're full we stay here at the Grange City. The room was clean but there were a few amenities missing - regular coffee sachets, coffee cream and shower caps. Got those second day. Both times I've stayed here I am working in the hotel room mid-morning and a member of hotel just sees fit to open the room door - no knock, no excuse me, nothing - just in they come. This bothers me every time. The hotel has brochures in the lobby that say their recent upgrades include free Wi-Fi in all rooms and free bottled water in room. Nowhere in the room was this noted, no code given to us for the free Wi-Fi, and when I had trouble with accessing at gbp12 for 24 hours (charged twice) the receptionist told me the concierge could just give me a code... so, got that and asked them to take the charges off the bill. Weird that you have to know to ask for this - it seems only to be free if you inquire. The free water never did show up in our room. All in all, a decent hotel and great location. Not ever going to be my first choice, but as an alternate it satisfies.

Reviews.Title: “A well located hotel in the City of London. Good at most things but not great”
Reviews.Author: MASWScreenwriter
Reviews.Content: This is a review of the conference facilities at The Grange City Hotel based on the cumulative experiences of three events. Overall this hotel is extremely well located for access to the City of London and transport, as others have noted. It is literally one minute from Tower Hill tube station. The hotel does most things well but this is to be expected for a 5 star hotel. The conference rooms in the hotel are well equipped. The public spaces are reasonably spacious for central London although the main restaurant can become a little cheek-by-jowl at times. Service levels at lunchtimes during these periods were good (meaning little or no waiting for food and plates cleared a lightning speed, perhaps to discourage second helpings?). Comments on the food itself follow. During the days we were there in November 2010, there were a number of quite large events being run simultaneously. Most of the time this was not a problem; on one occasion we were interrupted in our business meeting by the noise of a large lunchtime party leaving and owing to the size of the party, this took some time. It is difficult to see how this could have been avoided except by improved soundproofing or by different scheduling. Not catastrophic but not desirable either. Food and drink were in the main good but with some disappointments; the conference room coffee was most definitely not up to 5 star standards and attracted a number of comments to that effect. Accompanying pasties and the like were acceptable but at this level more than acceptable is expected. Lunchtime food was adequate mostly well prepared, cooked and presented but the amount of choice was disappointing. This did not become more extensive even when the hotel was extremely busy. Service was in the main good but there were times when conference personnel were not available meaning they had to be hunted down, paged or telephoned, which should be unnecessary at this level. Overall, then, not perfect but certainly ok. The hotel gets four stars overall in this review because it is really quite good at most things. But it doesnâ€™t warrant a full five stars, which is a pity as it claims to be a 5 star hotel and it should. It is not far off. A more personal approach would help. That might mean more staff. A number of members of staff were particularly helpful once they had been located. Perhaps there should be a little less emphasis on the purely commercial aspects which, as other reviewers have noted, do seem to drive this hotel perhaps a little too strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, reasonably priced, rooms OK but not a "luxury 5 star hotel"”
Reviews.Author: zoothemoo
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 1 night on business here. Chose this hotel as it was well located for work purposes and the price, for London, was not too bad. The location is excellent and very easy to get to via public transport; right next to Tower Hill tube station. However, don't be taken in by the marketing on the website saying that it is a "luxury 5 star hotel" - it isn't. That said, the price (for advance bookings) wasn't 5 star either, so, can't really complain too much. The room I had was OK. It was clean with all the usual amenities, but the room and furnishings looked slightly worn and dated. There were also marks on the sofa in the room and parts of the bedlinen (though, to be fair, the bedlinen was clean. They looked like marks which could not be washed off by standard housekeeping.). The view from the room was into the office next door. However, the room was quiet and there was no traffic noise. The toilet and shower in the ensuite worked fine. However, don't expect a large bathroom. Toileteries provided by hotel were OK, but think the person sourcing the toileteries for the hotel should try them out first before putting them in the guestrooms. It's kind of pointless having complimentary toileteries when you can't use them because you can't get them out of the bottle (e.g. the conditioner). Air-conditioning worked fine, albeit quite noisy. You may need earplugs if you are a light sleeper and need the air-conditioning on. Bed was comfy enough. TV worked fine. Usual complimentary refreshments available. Did not use mini bar and wifi, so, can't comment on those. Breakfast was average. I tried the full English breakfast and the chef accidently missed off some items. However, my tip if you are having the full English is - avoid the scrambled eggs and go for the fried eggs instead. (It could be, of course, the kitchen just having an off day that morning.) Service was inconsistent - waiting staff was quick to take breakfast order but nobody offerred me tea / coffee. There were pastries and croissants available, but instead of being light & buttery, they were strangely stodgy. All things considered, my stay was OK. Would not come back if I had to pay full price but might consider it again, if there is a good offer available. Just need to bear in mind that if you aren't paying "5 star" prices, don't expect "5 star accommodation".

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, superb views”
Reviews.Author: beachygirl187069
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grange City Saturday-Monday. The hotel was excellent, very pleased with the service, especially the helpful concierge when my partner was trying to book a restaurant for my birthday (got us a table at J Sheekeys easily which was an added bonus). We also received an upgrade free of charge so were lucky to get a room with excellent views of the tower. I don't think I would pay the 'going rate' as I think there is a limit on what any room is worth and if you cannot guarantee a 'room with a view' you would definitely think the hotel is overpriced. It's in a great location, right next to Tower Hill tube, attentive staff, and nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Facilities and Rooms Beautiful. Service Distinctly Average”
Reviews.Author: LvzWeekendBreaks
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through laterooms and were delighted to get a 5* hotel for 3* prices. The hotel had an excellent location- just a short walk from tower hill tube station, and less than 5 minutes stroll to the Tower of London. (The tube did shut ALL weekend for maintenance, so taxi's were quite expensive- next time i'd check for planned works before booking). Upon arrival, the staff were professional, but cold. There wasnt much of a welcome and we were asked to put a deposit for our room rate + Â£100, incase we incurred 'any extra costs'- we werent expecting to have to pay anything extra and it was lucky my friend had room on their credit card. We were told this would be returned within 'a few days'- not good if you've just come with enough money to cover your trip! The concierge service was free, fast and very convenient. Again though, staff attitutes were again professional but unfriendly. The room was AMAZING and HUGE. We had booked a basic room, but this still had a modern bathroom, large 'social' area with a desk, sofa, coffee table and comfy chairs, and a room for our beds, with a view of the river. Everything you would expect of a modern hotel room was provided. Downsides: the spare quilt and pillows provided were stained, room service had absolutley no knowledge of food allergies and couldn't provide any information on the food on their menu, or offer any food 'off menu' to suit our needs. Breakfast was expensive- c.Â£25 each (we went to the hotel next door!) and we didnt get free internet access in our room. Overall a really nice hotel to which i would return- at the discount price we paid. Mostly excellent, but no 'above and beyond'- i wouldnt stay if i had to pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to office but ghastly service”
Reviews.Author: salernch
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Grange City at least 5 times in the past 2 years and by now, you would think that they'd realize I'm a woman (all of my bills are for a Mr. X instead of a Ms. or a Mrs.) and that they'd have my address on file. But this is just a small annoyance. The rooms themselves are fine, though I'm not a huge fan of carpeting but this is London so what can you do? But trying to get to the room, through the numerous doorways, is frustrating, confusing and extremely annoying. I always end up getting lost. No one in this hotel really speaks English all that well and the front desk staff are just lazy, on top of it. The food is awful, and expensive. And overall, it's just not worth staying there. This past time, my tv seemed to be possessed. Turning on and off every 5 minutes while I was trying to nap. Fun times. And internet service? Firstly, it costs a fortune. And secondly, it barely works.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: Kingky
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a birthday weekend in London and were not disappointed. We booked directly via the hotel's website and saved some money by paying in advance (this, in fact, saved time at checkout). The standard room was a good size although the bathroom was a little small. The only downside was that the fixtures and fittings were starting to look tatty and worn in the bedroom and bathroom, so refurbishment should be due soon. Other than that, the room was well equipped, with a trouser-press, ironing board, full tea/coffee-making facilities and a small 'lounge' area. Staff members throughout the stay were courteous and friendly and, frankly, stood out from the vast majority of hotels I've stayed in this year. They really are an asset to the hotel. Continental breakfast was included in the room price but we could have upgraded to full English for Â£8 p.p., although we decided not to. I felt that the choice was a little restricted although the quality was good. Overall, I will return (as long as the prices don't get much higher).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: HolHolHol
