Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grange city on the night of our wedding and chose the hotel for its location although reviews were already mentioning the poor level of the service. Despite that I went in person to look at the room 3 weeks before the wedding and i booked the room by giving the details of my credit card, on arrival (in bridal wear) we were asked to pay the room in full. Nobody welcomed us or helped with the luggage and in the room there wasn't the promised fresh fruit. Breakfast in the morning was just average. Not worth the 4 stars or the money you spend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JSandA
Reviews.Content: We booked a superior double room, well it was more like a luxury suite. For a start the bathroom had three sinks, bath and shower and seperate shower cubicle with power shower all nicely presented and very clean, the room itself had a double bed two sofas two tables and chair and was big enough to hold a party in. The hotel is located just up the street from Tower Hill tube station, which is great to connect to all parts of London. Would def recommend and will be visiting again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, but otherwise would not return”
Reviews.Author: allisondeanlove
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a convenient location for the Tower Hill area and that's about the only positive. The room and bathroom were small. If it hadn't been for a meeting, I would not have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: midyfudge
Reviews.Content: this hotel is a good base for canary wharf no complaints at all

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not a 5* hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandy_toes222
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a convenient location for the Tower Hill area. That's were the good stuff ends. The room was tiny, stuffy and had not been decorated for at least 20 years. The wallpaper was vile. The bathroom was cramped. I had a charming view of some rooftops. I've stayed in far nicer rooms in a travelodge. Breakfast is adequate at best. The tables are spaced centimetres apart - far too close to the next person. The swimming pool is overun by people who live nearby and are members of the gym. They act like they own the place. I would never waste my money by staying at a Grange Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Utter Crap”
Reviews.Author: likey2travel Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay here against my better judgement because it was close to some meetings I was having. Here are the facts, not for a business traveller: 1. The TV was 13" -- I haven't had one this small since 1980. 2. No bathrobes or slippers in the room. 3. No shoe shine service available (told there was some machine I could use in the Lobby). 4. Bathroom was less than a meter wide -- see the picture. What a joke! 5. Ice machines on every third floor, one of the 8th floor was broken. 6. Location stinks. Yes it is near an Underground station, but I walked for 15 minutes looking for a corner store to buy soda and nothing was open on a Sunday. There are no restaurants or stores in the area open on the weekends. 250 pounds could have purchased way better. Stay away from here.

Reviews.Title: “very poor customer service - not worth the bother”
Reviews.Author: traveller85Uk
Reviews.Content: rooms not ready on arrival - eventually got into one of the two rooms booked but it was still dirty. left all bags there to get some lunch whist they sorted it out - spent another hour in reception trying to make them understand that they need to sort it out. was not checked in properly so were unaware at 3am that you needed to have given a credit card to get into the locked minibar for some water - and they did not offer to open it for us if we gave them a card then and there. planned to spend afternoon in spa but no time (spa facilities and cleanliness basic but OK). was told i should have come down to the reception to sort out the problems during the eveing time when it is less busy for them!!! right... going to ruin my evening plans as well as the afternoon - no thanks. rooms are nice enough when clean. the included breakfast is pretty poor. late night bar service was friendly and relaxed. we were told we could pay for room service breakfast when we check out but instead the room service man demanded money - which we did not have - then aggressively marched out and came back with a card machine - after all this faff the breakfast was cold and not worth eating. after our stay i wrote to the hotel and head office with ful details of the problems and all i got back was a load of pretentious crap excuses that did not address the specific problems i had. if you take out the fact that we stayed at this hotel, i had a great weekend, but wish we had just booked a good b&b for the money as this hotel is certainly no 5 star at the weekends when all their business guests have left - the customer service was awful: untrained, unhelpful, sarcastic and aggressive.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful base for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: BexyB
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Grange City on our wedding day, when relatives booked us in as a surprise. We came back a year later to celebrate our anniversary and were not disappointed. The hotel is very clean and comfortable and our room, a standard double, was great! The carpets are thick and soft and the bed superlative! On booking we had requested a South-facing room with a view of the Tower and were told that this couldn't be guaranteed, and sadly on arrival the view from our room was a bit rubbish - ugly roofs and a glimpse of Fenchurch St station. This was the only negative and I guess someone has to have the rooms at the back! The best part about the Grange City is the spa downstairs, with a 25m pool, wonderful 'starlit' jacuzzi' and various steam and sauna rooms. We used it every day of our stay, even after checkout! Another high point was the continental breakfast, included in our room rate, which offered a substantial menu. On day 2 we upgraded to English Breakfast for Â£8 each and ordered it up to our room, which we would do again though not every day. The minibar prices are reasonable for a hotel - a big glass of wine for a fiver without having to leave the room is ok in my book! We ordered room service dinner the first night which was delicious and pretty reasonably priced. The hotel location is excellent, just minutes from the tube station and near the river. We walked along the South Bank to Borough food market, and had a coffee in St Katharine's Dock. In terms of things that could be improved, providing conditioner would be nice, as would a DVD player as the films on offer were very expensive (Â£10 rental) and the choice pretty limited (absolutely nothing we wanted to watch). Being able to guarantee a room with a view of the Tower would be nice, though I realise that this may not be possible for logistical reasons. We will definitely be back, probably around the same time every year, and perhaps one day we'll get that elusive Tower view!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: alvy1179
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent deal, a really good price through late rooms. We were really pleased, lovely hotel just one minute from Tower Hill Tube Station. Great Location for visiting London. We arrived very early and were able to leave our bags securely with the concierge. (In fact we were allowed to leave bags with the concierge all day on the day we checked out). The room was lovely, small like most London hotels but really comfortable, great bed, large and clean with nice linen and washroom cosmetics. The AC was great and black out curtains made the stay comfortable and quiet. Only downside you have to pay for WIFI...... this should be free in a 5 start hotel. We would definitely stay there again though, we visit London frequently and this is the best hotel we have stayed at for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim_H_from_Lincs_UK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good quality modern hotel, which if you can get one of their deals (we got Â£90 per night), represents excellent value for money for London. It is well located, just 2 minutes walk from Tower Hill Tube. Note that because this is in the City it is quiet at weekends and many things, such as coffee shops and restaurants are closed. Can't really fault the hotel in any way, but I can't give it 5 stars, because it is just a modern box hotel, with nothing special to make it stand out.

Reviews.Title: “All round a great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DuffyCork
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the Aug Bank Holiday . We found the hotel to be great value and very clean,staff helpful and friendly we got an up grade as it was a birthday treat and we found the breakfast very good we did not up grade to the full english but what we had was perfect. The great plus is the tube station is a 3 minute walk and the hotel is very quiet at night.If I was returning to London I would stay here again I can not find any fault with this hotel what5 so ever.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Madeline1166
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Grange over the bank holiday weekend. Booked double with en-suite. On arrival the room was great, fantastic views overlooking The Tower. Complimentary bowl of fresh fruit, bathroom accessories were all Molton Brown which adds a bit more luxury. We used the pool and hot tub, changing rooms have all you will need including shampoos, etc and hairdryers, towels are supplied. For those of you who do not know London too well, looking at previous reviews many have stated that over the weekend there is not much choice of where to go. Should you wish to; a five min walk bearing left of The Tower brings you into St Katherines Dock, restaurant, bars and a beautiful harbour. If you fancy a slightly longer walk cross over Tower bridge and bear left where you will find Butlers Wharf; even more to choose from and first class. The water taxis are great, you can find them on the river at the end of The Towers walkway, if you like I would rather not take the tube. Free complimentary paper in the morning. Breakfast is lacking a bit but don't let that put you off, you can pay extra for full english but to be honest we found the breakfast to be quite adequate. Very good service and you can take your time and enjoy reading the papers in peace. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: wedding078
Reviews.Content: great location nr tube and a weatherspoons which was great because food was too expensive in the hotel.reception staff very helpful.hotel clean.we upgraded to a junior suite which was excellent as a standard room was too small.indoor swimming pool was beautiful.if we had to be critical was lack of entertainment in hotel.we would definately stay here again and would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “great location, Very Chic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjh777
Reviews.Content: tayed here as grange st pauls was full, england cricket team was staying here, mid way thru test match, so no great salacious stories, bothamesk, or flintoff , 9 th floor exec room,, overlooking tower of london, just awesome at night, room very clean, air con quiet, floor quiet,..great nights sleep, a well recommended hotel, by tube, not much parking but noticedd a ncp car park on way out, embankment headed

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room (executive) but really poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: PennyPurples
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grange City on a Friday night in August. The hotel is in a very convenient location with easy links to all transport. We walked to 1 Lombard Street Brasserie for dinner which we found had poor service but lovely food. We booked an executive room for Â£135 B&B (careful, their rates are shown ex-VAT). The room was very nice - two double beds and a couple of small sofas. The room and bathroom were spotless but the bathroom is very small compared to the room. We didn't have a good view but the courtyard we looked out onto had a view of part of the old City of London wall which was interesting. We had breakfast in the hotel around 10am on Saturday. The restaurant is in a very nice room and each table has big comfortable chairs. Strangely they don't give you a pot of tea/coffee but rather pour each cup for you. Persnally I'd prefer my own pot of tea. The food, I have to say, was really awful. Boiled eggs were without exception hard-boiled and cold, the pastries were warmed but, for example, there were pain au rausin with littrally 1 raisin in it, danishes with a mere smear of jam and hard croissants that are clearly the type delivered in a van and warmed up in-house and of the cheapest variety possible. Same for the bread. And the youghurst offered are only muler light. I've had much better breakfasts at a Premier Inn, let alone other hotels of this standard. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Grange City”
Reviews.Author: denles
Reviews.Content: stayed here for our wedding anniversary treat and was not disappointed. Upgraded to an exec view with a spectacular view of the Tower of London. Staff were very attentive and helpful, room was very clean and all the facilities were good. Really enjoyed our stay there and will definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel not quite 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: Mugpetie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a weekend with my wife. The rooms were nice , bathroom fine if a little small. The contintal breakfast was a little frantic but again fine. My one big gripe was that the room was not made up on Sat . We arrived back to the room at 1 am to find unmade beds, no freash towels or bathroom products etc. We had let the sign on to make up the room so this was dissapointing. When we mentioned this at checkout , no offer of recompense was forthcomming. I would expect better from a 5 star hotel hence the rating. But it has a great location for sight seeing and is really near the tube

Reviews.Title: “Super Break in Loodon”
Reviews.Author: yorkshiretravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night only on Saturday 14th August and wished we had booked for longer. The hotel is a 1 minute walk from Tower Hill Tube Station which is Ideal being on the circle line. The reception is lovely and very well staffed, directions to the room were clear and simple and there are enough signs on the walls to find your way easily. Our room was lovely just like on the website with a birds eye view of the tower of London and London Bridge in the background. Amazing! We ate out for dinner at a place just round the corner which was great as had our son with us so didn't want anything too formal for dinner. Had a great nights sleep, bed very comfortable and did I mention that view which was even more stunning at night when it was all lit up! Breakfast was included for a continental breakfast, my husband upgraded to a full english at a cost of Â£8 but myself and my son were more than happy with the continental. My son thought it was great, a good choice of cereals, toast, pastries, fruit, yoghurts, cold meats. fruit juice, tea, coffee and boiled eggs. The restaurant for breakfast is lovely and very well organised. All in all we had a brilliant time and can not fault anything. We will 100% be visiting this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for your stay”
Reviews.Author: NUAA_ZHAO
Reviews.Content: I and my wife lived in the Grange City hotel from 5 aug. to 8 aug. We found that is a very good hotel for living. It's clean and close to the underground station of Tower Hill. Anyway, I need your help to get a living invioce. When I check out from the hotel, thestaff told me that I need to get it from websit of reserving company "lastminute.com". When I asked them, they said that I need to get it from your hotel. I don't know if you can give me a suggestion. Thanks. You may contact with me by email. zhaoam@nuaa.edu.cn

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: smcl42
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Grange City, room only, with no complaints whatsoever. The room was clean, spacious and well equipped. We were on the 10th floor, and I have to say it was one of the quietest hotels I have ever stayed in - there was no street noise or noise from other guests at any time during our stay. The hotel is very close to the Tube so there is easy to access other areas of London. Breakfast seemed very pricey at Â£23.50, so we didn't indulge - Sainsburys and Tesco are both nearby, so we had a DIY breakfast instead.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - great service, views and location”
Reviews.Author: rangitoto10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our friends and family for our wedding - we were getting married in Tower Bridge so very close by. Guest relations couldn't have been more helpful. They organised everything for us and went out of their way to ensure that every single member of our party had a fantastic room and had a special stay. It really did add to the wedding weekend and helped make it an extra special weekend. We received so many comments about how much people had enjoyed their stay. The views of Tower Bridge, the Tower of London and the Thames are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “A business rather than leisure hotel - does what it says on the tin but poor service”
Reviews.Author: SaoireSaoirse
Reviews.Content: Location: literally one minute walk from the underground station (Tower Hill) so very handy. Near a lot of cool attractions. A little bit outside of the main city which we liked as it can be a bit mental in there. Rooms: We were given a small double room - it was perfectly amiable but it was not what we expected from a five star hotel. Service: The staff knew we booked a "secret" hotel deal on lastminute.com and treated us as such, which I find quite offensive. Just because we booked a bargain deal does not mean we dont know what five star treatment is or that we shouldnt get it. There was some initial confusion with rooms (we were given a twin room instead of a double) which was also poorly dealt with. I also feel that as we are in our 20s, rather than middle-aged-business-men (which is their average client from what we could see) that they treated us differently. Bar staff: Don't know how to pull a pint of guinness, very rude and short. General poor service and ill-equipt to deal with a lot of customers at once. Overall, besides check in and check out when we dealt with staff the hotel is great for location and comfort, if you're expecting a four star hotel and don't mind the poor service AND you've gotten a bargain deal. If I had of paid 200 per night to stay there I would have been sorely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - Service could have been better....”
Reviews.Author: mattnchar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled along with friends for a birthday weekend break in London. After searching reams of hotels, we saw that there was an excellent offer on at the Grange City Hotel. Very rare do you find a nice hotel in London with Leisure facilities such as a swimming pool...so we booked. After initially booking one night (2 double rooms, one room for us and one room for our friends) we then decided the next day that we would actually stay for 2 nights. We went back online the following day to book 2 more rooms for the additional nights stay. THAT IS WHERE IT ALL WENT WRONG. Upon check-in, the lady on reception said that we had 3 rooms on the 1st night and only 1 room on the 2nd night and was quite abrupt and confused when we tried to explain what we had done. After saying that they couldn't accomodate us as they were fully booked and having stood in reception for around half an hour, we were getting quite perplexed that we may indeed have been homeless for our 2nd night and be billed on the 1st night for a room we hadn't booked ! We were left in reception for another 15 minutes whilst 2 other members of staff got involved and EVENTUALLY we were told that they had indeed messed up the booking and apologised. We then got upgraded to Suites rather than standard rooms. Upon seeing our rooms, we were very pleased with the gesture the hotel offered us. Just a shame it took them a while to sort this out whilst insistent that WE had booked them incorrectly. Didn't eat in the hotel but the decor and surroundings were extremely nice and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is less than a 2 minute walk from the tube station so was extremely handy for commuting around London. All in all a good stay...apart from check in !

Reviews.Title: “Good infrastructure , very poor service”
Reviews.Author: mspip
Reviews.Content: My stay lasted 10 days so I had plenty of time to assess this hotel. It started well, the location is beautiful , 50 m max from both a train and a tube station and Tower of London at your doorstep. The infrastructures are nice, I am a huge fan of the 25 m swimming pool, jacuzzi, hammam etc. The location which started as a pro, proved to be in the middle of nowhere with no restaurants, supermarkets etc. for the evening The food and beverage in the hotel proved mediocre : restaurants are tacky and room service can take 1h to reach your room The reception was ok but the concierge was borderline rude and room service got the dry cleaning mixed up. Finally the decor is ABSOLUTELY tasteless. Painfully so. Think cxrystal chandeliers and fake wood panels.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location - Good Quality”
Reviews.Author: TDHLibertyMO
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the Grange City on a combined business and family vacation trip. I had previously stayed across the street at Novotel, which was fine. Grange City is better. It is very convenient to the Tube at Tower Hill and a short walk to the financial district. The rooms were clean and the service, particularly in the daytime, was excellent. At night, the front desk service was not up to par. The fitness room and pool are excellent. The rooms - we stayed in two in different parts of the hotel on separate legs of the trip - were quiet and comfortable, and larger than Novotel. The concierge and bellman were very helpful. I do not understand the negative reviews on this hotel. I did not find the rooms tired or any of the other inconviences claimed. Any negatives generally are not the fault of the hotel. For example, the nearest ATMs are not convenient, this part of the city is deserted on weekends (although the hotel was not), and nearby coffee shops are all closed on weekends. The hotel offers wireless service for a price, but check with the staff at the front desk to see if they can waive the fee if you are paying full price. Wireless signal was a little weak. This hotel is very pricey, but generally worth the money if it's within your budget.

Reviews.Title: “secret hotel booking for birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: doinkmonkey
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel using last minute.com as one of their secret hotel rooms deal. As it was my birthday our plan was visit london, do some shopping, eat some nice food and general relax. The staff were friendly and helpful. Until I discovered that I had left my necklace there ... getting it back could be a prolonged procedure if I base it on the phonecall I've just had and/or other people's experience described here. But on the whole staff seemed friendly. We did not eat in the hotel nor did we use the gym/pool/spa. The charges they wish to make for food seem somewhat expensive even for a 5* hotel - over 2.00 for crisps/choc bar. Our room was spacious, comfortable and well decorated. The bed was very comfortable. It would have been nice if the complimentary drinks (tea/coffee) had included hot choc, and maybe some biscuits a little more exciting than 'lotus'. But that's just my preference. Never saw the bathrobes, but in honesty was not that bothered. The location is fab .. just a few mins walk from Tower Hill (nearest Tube station - trust me much closer than Aldgate). Food wise we ate out and about during our stay. We loved the puddings at 54 Farringdon, which was surprisingly quite for a saturday night (mind you we had gone early, 6pm). The pub round the corner (the Minories) did some well priced tho average pub grub. Although dimmly lit in palces it did have good atmosphere & included (free) live music from a covers band who weren't too bad on the friday night. The area itself was close by to attractions such as Tower Bridge. At the weekend it is quieter as seems to be mostly a business Hotel/area. But we liked this. Overall we would stay at this hotel again IF we could get it on offer as we simply could not afford full price. And we will definately consider using the top secret hotels deal on lastminute.com again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price”
Reviews.Author: speedyjoe
Reviews.Content: Great value . Â£100 for executive twin ( upgraded by receptionist) , no breakfast as it was Â£23 but had perfectly reasonable meal at Tower Bridge Cafe . Pool added bonus and gym looked good. Beds very comfortable, bathroom clean and shiny. Staff very pleasant. Shame we didn't have a good view .

Reviews.Title: “It's a shame the 5 stars do not stretch to the service received from the staff.”
Reviews.Author: Robmeister_II
Reviews.Content: It's a shame the 5 stars do not stretch to the service received from the staff. Checking in 2 people out of a party of 9 was far too complicated for the receptionist who insisted, almost to rudeness, that he knew better who was sharing rooms. The bar staff were very slow and the white wine hardly chilled whilst the person maning the bag check could hardly write. The room was nothing special, a little dark and not as good as in many other 5 star London hotels. It was far too hot and the window wouldn't open. In actual fact, the 5 stars only seem to to exist so that they can charge Â£5 for a 250ml bottle of water.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous comfortable friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: lolatrip
Reviews.Content: Booked this on last minute.com as a top secret hotel, and was over the moon with what we got. The hotel is beautifully decorated and has a really expensive feel to it. The pool and facilities were brilliant and not too busy and the rooms were big enough with a very comfortable bed! The hotel is situated directly beside the tower hill tube station making travelling into the centre very easy and stress free! Really enjoyed our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but not worthy of 5 star rating.”
Reviews.Author: EssexUKChristine
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel which as previous reviewers have said is in a great location but a bit tired. Breakfast was okay, but not worth Â£23. Bathrobes non existent. If I'd paid Â£109 I'd have been happy but at Â£206 per room with breakfast not good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this great value hotel in the city.”
Reviews.Author: CapriCoupe
Reviews.Content: Right next to Tower Hill Tube and opposite The Tower of London, this hotel was perfect for our weddiing anniversary night away. Not being right in the hub-bub of the centre meant we took the opportunity to walk and talk both sides of the river. The room was small but clean and had everything we needed. A review said they had had a bad night due to the room overlooking the train station but our room overlooked a train line and we heard nothing at all. The continental breakfast which was included in the price was one of the best we have ever had. Don't bother paying the extra for the cooked unless you are really really hungry. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location for a wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: puppyeyes12
Reviews.Content: I stayed in double ensuite for two nights. It is a wonderful hotel. Rooms are fabulous and the bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever stayed in in my life! The staff at the Hotel were so friendly and efficient.If you called them for anything , they come up straight away and they are always happy to help you. Leisure centre is very relaxing , the lighting there is very good and services are great. Jacuzzi was lovely.The restaurant "The Forum" was gorgeous. I recommend the lobster! beautiful. Excellent location, actually right beside tower hill tube station, so it was marvelous. We even walked to St.Pauls cathedral from the Hotel which only took 10 minutes. Also the pier is very near if you need to use that. And you can hop on a city tour bus across the road , no distance. Fabulous stay all in all. I will definetely stay here again next time in London.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with a great location and very helpful friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: WaleshappyShopper
Reviews.Content: When I read the review written about this hotel before our trip I was very worried!! It is a very nice hotel, the room was clean and beds very comfortable, the staff could not do enough to be helpful, we were made to feel very welcome, breakfast was fine. The location is super and the area the hotel is in is very quiet and relaxing. If I was being very picky the decor is a bit tired. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, very comfy bed!”
Reviews.Author: Moramare
Reviews.Content: Woke up with a view on the Tower, could be worse... The Grange City is a very comfortable hotel at a 5 minutes walk from Lloyds of London. Wouldn't be sad if I would have to stay here once again...

Reviews.Title: “Great views, helpful staff, good amenities, excellent breakfast, clean & comfy”
Reviews.Author: mouthybird
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised by the negative reviews on here for the Grange City Hotel. I've just returned from a glorious weekend away with my mum to visit the Goghan exhibition & used the Grange City as our base. The first surprise of the weekend was an upgrade to our room when we came to check in. The next was the amazing views over Tower Bridge & the Tower of London from the floor to ceiling window in our extremely spacious room. My mother and I each had a very comfy double bed to sleep in & the room was well presented and clean. I've stayed in other hotels in London of similar price to the Grange City (only Â£94 per room per night) where the room has been just big enough to accommodate a bed, so the spaciousness of this room was a delight. The swimming pool, sauna, steam room & aromatherapy room were also clean, modern & lovely to use. I thought the staff were really helpful when we were trying to find somewhere to eat, they gave us a map & made a number of recommendations. The buffet breakfast was extensive & there was plenty to eat with unlimited hot drinks. The only negatives I would give to this hotel would be the price of drinks at the attached bar (but then it is in the heart of the city so not too surprising), and the location isn't particularly convenient for bars, cafes or restaurants at night.

Reviews.Title: “â‚¬97 per night per room in 5 star - has to be good value in London”
Reviews.Author: deinvisibleman
Reviews.Content: My gf and I booked this hotel on lastminute.com and were delighted to get a double room for such good value for Fri &Saturday. The only drawback was we had to book/pay in full before knowing which hotel we were assigned to. Thankfully - we were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The hotel is nicely situated within walking distance of London Bridge and 30 seconds walk from Tower Hill Tube station. This tube station in on circle and district lines so ideal if you plan on tubing your way around London. Taxi home will be expensive but then again this is usually the case when getting a taxi across London Town. The hotel itself is very nice although it's probably not a genuine 5 star anymore. Or at least not what one would nowadays expect a 5 star to be. But then again youâ€™re not paying 5 star prices!!! The staff are friendly and the hotel is bright and clean. The rooms are spacious with everything you expect to find in a 5 star hotel room. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for its location and price. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location BUT Thieving staff and Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Neoclem
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to accompany my husband on a business trip to London so being on the companys preferred hotel list we stayed here. We left with really mixed opinions on this hotel, the location is great, we had a fabulous view of the Tower Bridge by day and even more spectacular at night. But be warned once the business district closes down for the evening and on a friday night and the entire weekend, there are not a lot of dining options available. The worst thing about the hotel without a doubt were the miserable thieving staff. My husband made the mistake of asking for a bottle opener to be brought to the room, they refused to leave it claiming it was the only one in the hotel!? So every time my husband wanted a beer he had to request someone come with the opener which would then be promptly snatched back. After a few days we were growing tired of the inconvenience and requested it be left in our room, the staff member replied that it was not allowed as it would go missing-that's right, she accused us of wanting to steal it before we even got our hands on it. Another thing was the bar fridge, we didn't really consume anything from it due to the prices but we did use it to store our own things such as beer, fruit etc. Be warned that every time you move anything in the fridge the sensor detects this and charges you for it so everyday I had to go through the invoice that was pushed under the door crossing off all the things the fridge had thought we had consumed, so annoying. What a stupid concept too. We could also hear the family next door as the walls were quite thin. To top off our stay, when we returned home, my husband went to play his PSP only to find that the memory stick had been stolen. My husband contacted the hotel to report it and was told it would be investigated but of course never heard anything further. Needless to say when my husband returned to work and told his story of his stay this hotel was removed from the company's preferred hotel list. Great location but thats about all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but NOT 5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: L0nd0nLONDON
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of their last minute prices on their own website. We got a good deal for one night's stay. The room was great, overlooking the train platform but, for the price we paid, we weren't expecting a view of the Bridge. The facilities are great - sauna, pool, steam room etc. Use them. The hot water was unexpectedly broken for 3 and a half hours from 6pm onwards, no one called us back to tell us it was fixed. Our shower didn't work in the morning, we called 3 times and waited over half an hour for them to send someone up. By this time we took a shallow bath. This is not what one expects from a 5 Star hotel - the stars are not simply awarded for facilities but for service too, and we expected better. We complained, politely at checkout about the lack of hot water all evening and the lack of shower in the morning. The receptionist replied she would give us a late checkout. We didn't feel this resolved the situation. To which she replied that we paid a very low rate to begin with. This is very poor customer relations. We booked the room through them, and paid the rate we were given for our required dates. Very poor. Eventually the situation was resolved, somewhat to our satisfaction but not without hassle. Nice hotel but poor receptionist service. Oh, and very noisy air con.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special....a rip off if you ask me...”
Reviews.Author: daami1988
Reviews.Content: staff unhelpful......room in state of disrepair...........radio and tv didn't work. gym was hardly a gym. only redeeming quality was the breakfast but even that cost loads! the bathroom silicone was peeling. i asked for a bathrobe and i get 4 towels instead! for what it cost i will forever regret coming here. good location with it being near the financial district but honestly i think novotel across the road might have been a cheaper and more pleasnt experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, I think people just like to moan!!”
Reviews.Author: Leanne111
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for two nights 26th-28th March and I have nothing but good to say about this hotel. We booked through the hotels website and I emailed them to ask about anything able to be done as it was my boyfriends birthday whilst we were there. I emailed them about a month before our stay and had great correspondance with the hotel. They emailed me, rang me and upgraded our room and I arranged for rose petals to be put on our bed. Check in was quick, we got there at 1.30pm and were shown straight to our rooms on the 9th floor. The rooms were of decent size, I don't know what people expect from hotel rooms - a house?!? TV worked (although who goes to London to watch TV??), there was a cupboard with kettle, tea and coffee etc, another with a mini bar, an iron and ironing board and a hair dryer. The room was clean, tidy and well kept. The bed was possibly the most comfortable bed ever! The hotel is walking distance to the Tower of London and is literally round the corner from Tower Hill underground which is on the district line so goes pretty much direct to central London. For Â£5.60 each you can get an all day pass for travel after 9.30am from zones 1 and 2 which covers all of the major sightseeing areas. The staff at the hotel were so friendly and more than helpful in showing us where to go and which tubes to catch when we were unsure as to where places were. We went to Madam Tussauds - get there early it opens at 9am and queue's get big but make sure you stay calm, the amount of foreign tourists in there who push in front of you and barge you out of the way is VERY annoying. We also went on the Eye which was good, queue's went down fast so didn't seem like it took ages to get on there, and went to see We Will Rock You which was fantastic. We ate at Garfunkels in Leicester Square but there seemed to be plenty of them about, I would reccommend NOT eating here, the food was rushed and not particularly nice... it seemed that because it was busy they wanted you in and out; they took our starter plates away and asked if we wanted coffee or dessert - surely in 10 minutes you can't eat two courses???!!! Back to the hotel... we also had free use of the pool, sauna, steam room, hot tub and aromatherapy room. Use these!! Amazing, relaxing and a great way to wind down after walking around London all day. The pool was great, they give you towels and its perfectly clean. Overall the hotel was perfect, I would go back tomorrow and definitely reccommend it. I'm sure people just like to moan over nothing - yes the internet and phone was expensive to use...as in all other hotels!! The rooms were great as were the staff - if one member couldn't help they went and got someone who could. Ignore the bad comments, especially about things like bags not being carried, the lifts are literally round the corner from reception, stop being lazy!

Reviews.Title: “Room with an awful view”
Reviews.Author: Hedgeman63
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most expensive hotels in the city, but you might wonder why. Most rooms are very small and dark and have a view on the underground. Service is unfriendly and when I visited their Sushibar a year and a half ago it was one of the worst meals ever. Never go here would be my advice

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: HHHHH_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 2 minutes away from tower hill station, its in a great location for london sights such as the tower of london, london bridge, london dungeon, london eye, london aquarium etc. The hotel staff were excellent, very friendly and helpful. the gym was very well equipped and the pool, sauna, steam room and aromatherapy room were lovely and free of charge to use. i wish i stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad but standards are lagging behind the competition”
Reviews.Author: gtscad
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a number of times and I would not describe this as a five star hotel. The rooms at the front have a nice view over the Tower but those at the back are just feet away from Fenchurch Street station. Our room was small and reasonably furnished (but a bit 'tired'). Unfortunately, on the 2nd floor, it was at railway platform level. The triple glazing kept the the noise down but my wife found it difficult to sleep owing to the constant low-level 'drumming'. The (expensive BOSE) radio didn't work properly, the TV was on the blink and neither remote control worked. The shower screen was off its tracks and generally it was not that clean. I agree with another reviewer in that they seem to put 'special offer' guests in the very worst rooms. Why? - they were not busy. We probably won't stay here again because the recently refurbished Tower hotel is quieter, has better rooms and beautiful views over Tower Bridge and Katherine's Dock.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and flawed”
Reviews.Author: Kims0304
Reviews.Content: The service is average. The room was old fashioned and looked more like a corridor with a bed shoved in it. There was a dirty phone by the bed that did not even work, no free Wifi, the tv remote did not work., and the drawers had broken cables, hairdryer cap, etc, in it. The breakfast was expensive and not all that great. The bathroom was spotless and might be the redeeming element together with the central location. Next time, I'll check into the Novotel across the street.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel? Oops..........”
Reviews.Author: trevlind
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel from last minute 'secret 5 star hotels' hoping for a 5 star bargain but like a lot of these hotel sites you tend to end up with rooms that they couldn't put you in for their full price. The hotel is well located for the tower of London but with the tube lines suspended over the week-ends it will cost a taxi ride everytime you want to go in to the city. Like another reviewer said, the area the hotel is located in is the financial district and as such is dead at weekends, and I mean dead! We couldn't find one pub open within walking distance on the Sunday night. The hotel room was a tiny - two people couldnt walk passed each other in it. The bathroom sink had a crack running up it and the bed? Had better in a travel lodge. Only plus I could find was the spa. No free wireless either! Sorry but this is not a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: isswhizz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a weekend with three friends and we paid one hundred pounds each for two nights. The rooms were fantastic.....spacious and luxurious. We loved the Molton Brown goodies. The staff were unbelievably helpful and friendly. Check in and out was quick and easy and the facilities brilliant. We will definately be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: thebroons
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight for a theatre break with friends. We had a twin room which was huge, on the 8th floor and overlooked Tower Bridge. Hotel was excellent, clean and we were very impressed. Overall staff were friendly. We had a buffet continental breakfast which surpassed our expectations. Excellent location for underground. Drinks in bar and room service were very expensive. Can recommend the leisure facilities, which were included in our package. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel and would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: justagirl12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for my 40th birthday. At check in the receptionist gave us an upgrade because my partner mentioned it to her. The room was lovely and huge with view of the Tower of London. We used the gym and swimming pool/sauna/steam room; very relaxing. We had lunch at the bar, but the service was a bit slow. Breakfast was not 5*, more a 3*; breakfast room was very crowded in the weekend and almost no space to get to your table. Food was fresh, but no fresh orange juice. You had to pay extra for English breakfast (Â£8). Not much choice of (brown) bread.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - but not 5*****”
Reviews.Author: skinkaid
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is great - clean rooms, pleasant staff but I have no idea where it got it's 5* rating. I stay regularly in 5* properties and this would be a very comfortable 4*. The door man may have had a top hat on but he was not as efficient as other similar hotels I have stayed in! We even had to carry our bags to our rooms - no one offered to carry them which is the normal procedure in 5* properties. The standard room was fine - room was above average size for central london and this was good. The bathroom was tiny but the size of the room more than made up for it. The baths were very deep and high - my elderly relative struggled to get a shower. All in all it's a good hotel. Would I stay here again? YES I WOULD! It was good value for money and we had 2 pleasant nights overall.

Reviews.Title: “More like poor 4* or good 3 *”
Reviews.Author: Sipi69
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Lastminute.com (secret hotel deal) for Â£85 which, for a 5* hotel would be a fantastic deal, the problem is although somewhere, someone, gave this hotel 5* it is definitely isn't. The Staff, although pleasant are nearly all foreign (I did not speak to any native English speaking staff) and one or two obviously had very little experience of working in hotels, let alone 5* establishments. The Hotel itself was generally clean but there were lots of empty glasses left on tables in the bar, something that makes the place look untidy. The guest room was generally clean but there was quite a lot of brown grouting in the bathroom tiles which is one of my pet hates. The Room was quite small with just enough room for a king size bed desk small round table and two chairs. The bed was one of those that folds into a built in cupboard on the wall, something I've never experienced in a 'quality' hotel before, because of this there wasn't a standalone bedside table making it difficult to find anywhere to put your drink. The mattress was also quite hard and lumpy which didn't make for a particularly comfortable nights sleep. The Tea & Coffee making facilities were very poor with only cheap instant coffee, typhoo tea bags and no hot chocolate, there were two packets of biscuits which were alright. There was no bottled water in the room. The toiletries are all Molton Brown and very nice. For Â£85 in London you'll find it hard to find something better but it makes me very cross that this has been awarded 5* when it just isn't. The last time we were in London we stayed at Browns which was a fantastic, you definatly get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Much improved”
Reviews.Author: Boggsie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a number of months ago. This was not a good experience as a member of staff put my credit card details at risk. They took this seriously and made reparation. We received room upgrades and they dealt with the issue. Reception is a pleasant space and the staff very helpful. The rooms are excellent and beds very comfortable. Bathrooms are functional although if you have mobility difficulties, the sills into the bath are high. The health spa is excellent. The breakfast is very good although they did forget some members of our party when they were busy. Swift service resumed when we pointed out their mistake. Overall recommended. It is right beside Tower Hill Underground Station and The Tower of London/ Tower Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirlcph
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grange City for a couple af nights during mid-January and had a splendid experience. I booked the room via the hotelÂ´s own website and got room + breakfast for the same price, I should have paid for just the room, if I had booked on one of the many international booking sites. The hotel is located less then 100 meters from the Tower Hill Underground and just across the road from Tower of London and Tower Bridge. It was perfect for a quiet, nice stroll along the Themsen on a January evening and after a day of shopping it was nice to get away from the crowds on Oxford and Regent Street and just being able to relax in comfortable surroundings. When we arrived, we had been upgraded to a suite and were given a room consisting of a bedroom, a living room and (of course) a bathroom with both a shower and a separate tub. The bathroom was not the largest I have seen, but everything was in order. We almost had a view of Tower. The room was clean. The breakfast was continental and what you would expect from this type of hotel. We tried the hotels Sushi restaurant - very nice and good prices. The staff was incredible. They were helpful, interested and really wanted you to have a nice stay. We went looking for a tiny shop in London, but couldnÂ´t find it. So we called the concierge, who went online and found the correct address for us - thatÂ´s service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and great facilities”
Reviews.Author: MartinBorrill
Reviews.Content: We had a package deal for 3 days followed by a Christmas deal for a further three. We were upgraded t a larger room for the entire stay. The continental breakfast was adequate though unimaginative for a hotel of this calibre. The bar area was poor - we drank across the road in another hotel (Novotel or similar) or at the Tower Hotel (Gouman). We had one evenng meal (part of the package) and the food and service were very good (wine was poor and selection limited) though if you were paying, I would say there is better value locally. It was very clean, quiet and a good view of the Tower of London but what set it apart were the friendly staff and the spa facilities, incl a large pool. Disappointing that the internet was Â£5/hr

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BuntySYorks
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the Grange City Hotel as a treat for my sister's birthday and I would have no hesitation recommending it to others.Check in was swift and we got a complimentary upgrade-the room was lovely with a tower view-it was spotless clean and lovely Molton Brown toiletries in the bathroom.The staff were lovely and helpful and it was great to be able to control the temp in the room ourselves(normally hortel rooms are stuffy and hot).Continental breakfast was superb with lots of choice.treat yourself and use the spa and pool you won't be disappointed-its just luxurious.I can't speak highly enough of this hotel-location is a real plus as the tube is literally just outside.If you want luxury for a very reasonable price then try the Grange City Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - WILL stay again.”
Reviews.Author: blueandy2525
Reviews.Content: First off, somebody had an issue with the Â£50 'frozen' credit card charge. WHY? Isn't this common practice in many hotels? For us it was no problem because, having decided they could not accept a Maestro Debit Card, the hotel agreed to lock the room's mini bar (which we didn't want to use) and only charge us by cash in the hotel's bars/restaurants. We were more than happy with this arrangement. The room we were allocated had no view at all but, despite that, was wonderfully clean and comfortable. Knowing in advance how much meals and drinks would cost in such an establishment, we chose to eat and drink 'out' and, being in LONDON, there was quite a choice available! However, after watching the show that was the reason for our trip, we chose to use the hotel bar for our 'nightcap' and were well impressed with the service offered - although it was late into the evening. With a long trip home the next day, we decided to take advantage of the 'Continental Breakfast' that came with our room package and were allowed to eat ' as much as you like' style until we were satisfied. This was a good indication of the staff tolerances which were, without fail, superb. I would recommend this hotel to any person using these reviews. Finally, I would say to those who have questioned the ethnic origins of the majority of the staff, get over your problems people! I found the staff, to a person, were brilliantly polite and helpful. FIRST CLASS!

Reviews.Title: “luxury hotel will stay again”
Reviews.Author: kedge
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a lovely stay at Grange City Hotel and will definately stay again. Great value at 100pounds and was upgraded to an executive suite becuase they were unable to fulfil my request for a room with a view. The room was extremely large, the bed comfy and the towels were fluffy.....If you want a bathrobe however you need to request it with reception. Regretably never got the chance to use the leisure centre but took a look at it and the pool was amazing. The staff are extremely helpful and I think they must love there job because they all seemed so cheerful. Also if your shoes get muddy they have a machine by reception that polishes them!!!!!! The only thing I would say is that we booked breakfast at 15pound each because we wanted the whole five star experience and take my advice it is not worth it. It only includes continental and if you want an english breakfast on top its a further 8pounds so thats 23pound for breakfast all together. I saw one of these breakfasts and it didnt look much to rave about. My advice would be to go to The Minories pub, its just round the corner and on there menu breakfast was the full english with a drink for 4.99...it looked great!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Woken up 3 times in the next”
Reviews.Author: Cazywaz
Reviews.Content: Our friends suggested this hotel. After reading the reviews on Tripadvoisor we booked requesting a room on a high floor with views over the Tower. This was provided and the room was fantastic and so was the view (floor to ceiling window), both better than expected. However on the 2nd night the TV switched itself on at 4:30am inthe morning, waking us up. We couldn't work out why but turned it off and went to sleep. IT happened again at 5:15 and 6am. I phoned reception to ask them to stop this happening but their english was not good enough to understand and after 5 mins I put the phone down. On complaining the following morning we were offered a full english b/f as compensation, which we didn't want. But nothing off the bill. So we have been promised a disocunt next time we stay - lets see if that happens. Apparently it was due to some upgrade over night and "this sometimes happens" and has happened in the past. The buffet breakfast was OK for us, though the toast was cold as cooked on mass every half an hour or so. The cooked b/f was Â£20 extra per head. This was not advertised and the waiter went around asking all the guests if they wanted a full english - so I am sure that people had a surprise on checking out. We used the pool, which wasn't as bad as some of the reviews. I had informed the hotel that the booking was to celebrate a significant birthday but there was no little extras or mention of it - which was a bit disappointing. Overall a good hotel with great views but a bit rubbish if you've got a problem and the staff can't understand you to sort it out. If it wasn't for this I wold have given it a higher score

Reviews.Title: “Great Location although wouldn't say it was 5*”
Reviews.Author: Stenny-Physio
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I travelled down to London on January 4th for 2 nights at Grange City which was booked though Last minute for a relaxing break before going back to work after xmas. Last minute was great had lots of great offers, so many we couldn't decide which hotel to book, but we went with grange city as it had leisure facilities. The hotel location was fantastic about 10 steps to tower hill tube and within easy access to anywhere within london. The staff were ok although I expected better with it being 5* although one women in the leisure centre did call me HER. The rooms were small but comfortable, and the leisure centre was amazing except of course the women at the reception desk. Overall we had a great time and I would recommend the hotel for location and leisure facilities although I would not give it 5* status. The novotel was just across the road and looked nice might try that next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: 2aspen
Reviews.Content: We arrived early 10.30am and were given our room straight away, we were upgraded to room 912 which has a fantastic review of the tower of london, large bed and 2 sofas. The room is well equipped with tea/coffee, ironing etc. The bathroom is small but does the job. The room was very clean. The staff were extremely polite and helpful. We had breakfast which was plentiful. The Isis bar was ok, service not very good but reasonably priced for food and drink. I had a massage in the spa/treatment centre which was great Â£80 for an hour aromatherapy. We used the pool and jacuzzi which were fine but not that warm. The japanese restaurant and wine bar are not open weekends which i found strange and disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “superb in almost every sens”
Reviews.Author: swadesmet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is runned by foreign people from many different countries and you will hardly find one English employee.Nevertheless everything is perfect and all employees are extremely helpful and friendly.The restaurant have very good food and good wine choice. Our previous experience with English food was disgusting in different restaurants so we wanted to known this time who was the cook.He was Indian !

Reviews.Title: “Expensive disappointment”
Reviews.Author: onhols37
Reviews.Content: Purchased a New Year break as a surprise for my boyfriend from lastminute.com; one of the "top secret hotels", so although I didn't know the exact location I did know what it was a 5 star hotel in the City and had superior leisure and spa facilities. The deal from last minute was no better than booking direct with the hotel. The location turned out to be very good with easy train links. My issues were with the 5 star status. I agree with other reviewers in that the rooms do not appear to be pre-allocated. After a whispered 'phone call, presumably to house keeping we were allocated a room on the 8th floor. This room was the third number written on our card key; the other two having been crossed out. We checked in nearly two hours after the 2pm earliest check-in time. The room was always cold, there was a foul smell from the water tap and the towels (presumably washed in the same water) also smelt very unpleasant. The tap water was undrinkable and there was no bottled water available in the room. The view was of the DLR platform, there was no net curtain so if you wanted privacy you had to have the curtains drawn and lights on. Although the spa advertised children free times these were not adhered to so a relaxing trip to the (cold) pool was like a Saturday afternoon at your local leisure park. There were some pretty foul-mouthed and loud people in the bar at 7pm on New Year's Eve who continued to be served alcohol....not what you expect in a 5 star hotel. In all, not a disasterous stay and the staff we dealt with were efficient and friendly. The location is good, but the hotel lacked that luxurious feel that they advertise.

Reviews.Title: “Definetly not a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: YoungCouple86
Reviews.Content: I have never been more disappointed with a hotel. Staff where cold upon check in, our shower didnt work we reported this at 10am and at 5pm it still wasnt fixed on both notifications we received a brush off from the duty manager, even though we pointed out on the first occasion that we would be out for the entire day and had tickets for a show in the evening we where assured it would be fixed. When we reported it the second time we pointed out that we stayed at a 5 star hotel because we where on a busy trip and would expect the shower to work as an absolute minimum of any hotel again we where brushed off i will never stay at this hotel or any of their chain again. 3 star hotels that i have stayed in are better value for money, and the showers work. The walls where far too thin we could hear people in the next room talking and could nearly join in!!

Reviews.Title: “Eleganct, Sophisticated and Utterly Charming”
Reviews.Author: WendyDoc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from an amazing two night New Year break at The Grange City Hotel! The Hotel exudes elegance and sophistication and the staff all utterly charming! By far the best hotel we've stayed at in London and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Shocking customer Services throughout our five day stay!!! 5 star location run by 1 star staff!”
Reviews.Author: SuttonWilson01
Reviews.Content: Firstly, it is worth pointing out that I have this year alone stayed in five star hotels in Hawaii, San Francisco, Las Vegas and London and although with varying degrees of pleasure have never felt compelled to write anything good or bad on this type of site - but wanted to warn people about the hotel...! Shocking experience! Imagine my excitement when my girlfriend surpised me on boxing day and said that she had booked a 5 star hotel for a nice relaxing stress free break between 27th December until 1st January..... Well let me tell you exactly how that excitement vanished almost immediately.... We only live in Sutton in Surrey so to get the train to the hotel would have only taken 40 minutes but due to the fact that we had luggage I suggested I call and ask if they had a car park for guests staying at the hotel. After having to explain my simple question in several different ways , I was put on hold and another person answered - I had to once again explain my question but the other person (on reception) wouldnt tell me the anwer until I had given all our booking details and references etc, aarrrgggg! ...before declaring that YES the hotel had parking available to guests and YES we were entitled to one....Great! I thought , even if that took ten minutes to find the answer... So we set off and and an hour and a half later we arrived at the hotel. Great looking hotel from the outside so we were delighted. We joined the back of queuing cars, appearing to be going down to the car park (under the hotel) and after 10 minutes of going nowwhere my girlfriend went in to reception to find out where to park exactly and what the hold up was. We were told the parking was 5 minutes away and would cost Â£2.50 a day - ok, so not exactly what we were expecting but ok we could deal with that...We then asked for directions, which for some reason didnt seem readily available and were then handed some after another 5 minutes of waiting and to our dis-belief on the directions was the cost of the car park - Â£2.50 PER HOUR!!! so our stay was going to cost us an extra Â£150 odd quid , even though someone from the hotel had confirmed that parking was included.... We asked to see the manager to discuss this and the situation only got worse......We waited another 5 minutes for him to come down to reception only to be told that he didnt believe one of his staff would have said parking was included and that unless I could provide him with a name there wasnt anything he could do?!! I couldnt believe this....I was beign accused of lying and besides the staff never introduce who they are when answering the phones so this was impossible.... We asked him to be a little flexible as there was eveidentally plenty of parking underneath the hotel, which has a large conferencing facility....but he once again repeated that there wasnt anything he could do. I explained that we would not have driven had it not been for this mis-information we were given and that I wanted to know about a refund (I only got to this point because he appeared to really not care) as we were not happy and would stay at another hotel...He then walked off and came back 10 minutes later with a solution we thought - NO! he merely pointed out that we would still have to pay the bill in full as we hadnt cancelled 24 hours prior .... This was aready a nightmare and reduced my girlfriend to tears right there in reception and wasnt exactly the first impressions written about in the brochure!....By this point we had been at the hotel for half an hour , our car was in a non-moving queue outside , we wasnt checked in and the hotel management were basically saying we were liars!! Great Start...!! To be fair to them , as it was a bank holiday the hotel manager suggested we park our car oustide the hotel on a yellow until just before 6am and then move it to the paying car park so save on a days rate...Due to the fact this was supposed to be a relaxing holiday we didnt take him up on that offer. Having been told we would lose over Â£500 by cancelling we reluctantly parked the car at the pay car park and trudged the 10-15 minute walk back with our bags but it didnt end there! The room we were allocated was actually on the same level as the train station platform , so people who were bored could look straight in to our room which was not very private at al and felt very unsecurel....We swiftly returned to reception to ask to be moved and were (to their credit) given a room on the 8th floor which was clean and a standard double, which was to be our home for 5 days.... I will simply sum up our remaining experience : 1) We reported to reception that we had a message appear on our phone but couldnt acccess it as when you followed the instructions it died - the girl didnt know the answer but would call back - no call back 2) Even with the heating on the rooms were very cold and we had to request an extra duvet. 3) After a couple of days we thought to ask consierge if they could find out if there was any other (cheaper) car parks in the area - they said they would phone back - yep, you guessed it....! no call back. 4) There was never a welcome or goodbye by any of the staff throughout our stay and was a very odd and unfriendly atmosphere. 5) The walls are too thin and you can hear conversations people are having either side of your room at night. 6) Some rooms have blaconys and we were unlucky enough to be above one that had - The noise from these balconies from people partying or smoking has already been mentioned in a review so I wont go into it - just that it is loud! On the plus side, I have to say the gym and spa was a delight and we enjoyed this very much and the location is perfect. Having stayed at the Grange in St Pauls in October I know that the issues are not with the chain but with this particular hotel....But unfortunately and as with most people who experience bad customer services, we are put off the chain altogether. We are happy to be home!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: mutter38
Reviews.Content: Family of five checked in 19 th dec -23 th dec , warm welcome from the receptionist and room was ready. We had booked this hotel on the Grange City hotel webside and is one of very few hotels that take 5 people in a room in London. 2 adult, three children one nearly a teenager. Room was cleaned every day and it was with two big beds and two daybeds we only used the one of them We had room number 526 with a good view to Tower of London and Towerbridge wich was nice. One comment since this hotel is geared for buisness travellers and they donÂ´t always have breakfast inclusive check that You have breakfast inclusive at Your stay. We had the breakfast inclusive and it was very nice with a lot of stuf to choose from. They have a big swimming pool wich we looked at , but never used , we never had the time for it. We ate in the bistro Luciane wich was very good food, but the room itself was very cold . My compliments for the doorman and luggages men/boys they where just so nice and good and we got so many great advices from them and they made our stay even more pleasent with all their knowledge. The hotel lays in short walkeble distance from underground , bus servicÂ´s and Tower of London and Tower bridge wich was two of the things that we wanted to see on this trip wich made the hotel a perfect place for us to stay. It was easy to use the tube and busÂ´s to go to other places, and we used it when we where going to see Big Ben and that area. We had a great time in London and at Grange City hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel; great location!”
Reviews.Author: srcKentUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in December and it was fantastic. I emailed the hotel a few days before asking for a "room with a view!" Our room was wonderful, huge, 2 large double beds and our windows looked onto tower of london. We were not in the hotel for long but the staff were all very friendly and the room was very clean. We ordered room service which was lovely and not that expensive considering. The spa itself is lovely, water a little cold but very relaxing although quite busy as was a weekend. The hotel is an idea location with only a 5 min walk to the tube. Breakfast itself was nice, could choose from a wide variety and we had a table straight away however noticed a long queue forming while we were eating so think its worth getting down to breakfast before 9.30! On check out i asked whether that was a "standard" room (i had paid for that) and was told that it was a superior as i had emailed asking for a good view and therefore they had upgraded me at no extra charge, thought this was extremely good and worth emailing beforehand! Would recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 stars!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: johnnytje
Reviews.Content: Continental breakfast is a joke for 23 pound.Thy charge extra for a expresso when you take a breakfast.No friendly staff!!Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable London room with a great view”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust_00
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located. As others have noted, its just around the corner from Tower Hill tube station. Our room had an amazing view of Tower Bridge. The room itself was large, clean, well furnished and comfortable. The only annoying thing was that the ice machine on our floor didn't work. We booked through a deal on last minute, and at the reduced price, it was good value. Overall a great hotel in a pretty location.

Reviews.Title: “Proclaimed 5* hotel with 3* standards”
Reviews.Author: stewief1
Reviews.Content: Booked using a combination of points and money. Stayed 2 nights at this hotel over a weekend. Without doubt, the main advantage of this hotel is its location - excellent proximity to the tube and mainline services, and we walked along the Thames into the city which took a few hours, but was amazing. The hotel check-in staff were perfunctory, and not friendly in the slightest. No offer from porters to take the bags to the room. Room was exceptionally small (probably the smallest i have stayed in, in all my 9 years of extensive traveling). Faulty kettle had to be reported twice with a 7 hour gap between. Quickly exchanged for a working one after being reported for the second time. Did not have time to explore the fitness area so wouldn't like to pass comment. Check-out was again perfunctory and again, unfriendly. I have stayed the the Grange Fitzrovia before and i was so much more impressed and would happily go back to that hotel, but not this one. Felt undervalued as a customer, and paying 5* prices (whether using points or not), this was a let down.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping issues - indifferent response”
Reviews.Author: Eileen73
Reviews.Content: I stay at The City Grange quite regularly as a business traveller. It's really close to Tower Hill underground, Fenchurch Street Station and Tower Gateway, and is well placed for the City. I love staying here as the rooms are really geared towards the business traveller. The main perks are robes in the room, a separate table/chair (for eating/working) and magazines. The recreation facilities are also excellent - the pool is lovely. The last time I stayed at the hotel the magazines were missing from the room, as were the robes and to cap it all off the mini-bar hadn't been replenished properly - a half-drunk bottle of wine was still in there from the previous occupant! Housekeeping did come with the robes and magazines, but there was little apology for the wine/inconvenience etc. I've used The Grange for six years and may be thinking of giving another one of the hotels in the area at try - it's seen better days. Would I recommend it? Well, I suppose I would, but not without pointing out its failings.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but overrated and over priced”
Reviews.Author: russjp68
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a fantastic location next to the tower of London. The rooms were very clean, but nothing special. The major issue I had with the hotel was the Very ,very , very thin walls. The people in the next room could be heard talking all night. They were not talking loud, but every word could be heard ! In addition to this the TV volume would not work, so I couldn't even drown the noise out ! The general facilities were fantastic. Although on the whole this hotel was very nice, because of the room wall issue, and the price of the hotel, ( without even talking about the cost of the breakfast ! ) I would say that value for money was not received. 4 Star hotel. 5 Star price !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and needs refresh”
Reviews.Author: Nalced
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Nov 16. Room rate of Â£300 for the night excluding breakfast. Huge room which included a sitting area. However the bathroom was tiny - nowhere to put my bag of shaver etc. The sitting area did not have a television nor could you see the one in the bedroom from the sitting area. There was no mini bar in my room either although one of the myriad of pieces of furniture did have space for one. The room itself badly needed a refresh. Hotel itself is nice and very centrally located but for Â£300 you expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Hotel but in no way deserving 5 *****”
Reviews.Author: Mikered
Reviews.Content: When you book 5* and pay for 5* you expect high standards. This hotel does not deserve the high rating. They look after the reception which is very nice along with the bar, but you are not living or sleeping in the lobby. The room is large but not clean at all, the cleaners even knock on the door and wake you up early (I suppose this is to finish earlier). Stayed for one night and checked out the next day. I suggest staying at the newer hotel The Grange in St Pauls.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, spacious room .great pool ,great views and location”
Reviews.Author: pepsimaxrock
Reviews.Content: WOW this hotel was a surprise. It was so perfectly located with fantastic views over the Tower of London. We had booked a cheapie and got a lovely room with a little lounge area. A quick 24 hour London trip from the North to see a great exhibition - Anish Kapoor at the RA- it was fun and definitely worth travelling to see - we managedto get Tate Modern in and a walk around the tower of London and across Tower Bridge, down the south bank to Bankside and the Tate, great stuff. But we had a fantastic time at the hotel - it had the best pool of many hotels I have been in - 25 metres !! and it was so quiet. And this is EC1. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “A room with no view... but extremely spacious”
Reviews.Author: WorldRoamersUSA
Reviews.Content: As we asked for a spacious room where we would be able to move around with a wheelchair, we expected a nice double room. What we got, was a 17 meters x 12 meters large suite and a bathroom with a real large bath, 3 tubs and separate shower. During our stay from Friday thru Monday we kept the curtains closed, as the view was an big office and a railway station. The room was absolutely sound proof and we slept like a log. The continental breakfast was absolutely great and we have never seen during a hotel breakfast so many personnel. The personnel was very courteous with no exception. In the weekend one has to pay an extra BP 8. On Monday morning all cooked English breakfast ingredients were available without extra charge. The TV set in the suite was rather poor. Just a simple small TFT screen which was far too small to look at from the bed. The airco was good, both cold and warmer. The quality of the bed and other furniture was excellent. The hotel is hidden just behind the underground station Tower Hill. We found out that this station is unaccessable for wheelchairs, so - once we arrived on the station - we could not exit!!!! We had to travel further to Westminster Station to exit the underground and take a bus. The rest of our stay in London we only utilized buses. Whenever we will visit London again, we will certainly book one of the Grange hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: E-Trip11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 night Fri/Sat in October. The hotel can boast an excellent location only 30yards walk from Tower Hill Tube, 20 mins from kings Cross. 5 mins walk from Tower of London, 5 mins London Bridge! This is an upmarket safe part of London. The booking in procedure was easy, staff were polite and professional The first room we were given was 423 this backed onto Fenchurch train station and we could see the platform from our window only 50 feet away. The windows were triple glazed however at 6.50am i could here bing bongs and train announcements. I spoke to the concierge and was moved with no fuss to the 10th floor, this room was much quieter and had a better view than of a train platform. The continental breakfast was nice and restaurant staff were excellent, i would use this hotel again especially the swimming pool, 2 x saunas, jacuzzi bath, and steam room !!!!

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MarcSPA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in October. The hotel is very smart and the check in was fantastic, ladies on reception were as friendly as I have had anywhere. Room was very well appointed but also quite small. We did not stay for breakfast as we found an Italian Deli round the corner that did great food and it was fairly cheap. Hotel breakfast was Â£17.50 each so we didn't bother. On first night we had a meal in the Japanese restaurant which was ok, but I would not eat there again. Much better to walk over tower bridge and turn right where there are a few restauarnts and bars etc and it's a nice walk. We tried to get into Jamies Olivers 15 restuarant which is a short taxi ride but it was fully booked. Location is very good as yo have the DLR, Tube and Fenchurch St station on your doorstep. Taxi from Kings Cross to hotel was Â£10 (you can easily get there on the Tube though if you prefer). All in all for Â£200 it was very good value - recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: finroach
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Grange City Hotel for four nights, had a good deal from lastminute.com Top Secret Hotels. The hotel is in a great location, near to the Tower Hill underground station and of course to the Tower of London and Tower Bridge. I had a Superior Room (which is - if I understand correctly - their standard room). The room was facing towards the Fenchurch Street railway station, but you could hear no noise from outside (however see comment below from the noise inside). Bed was big and comfortable with plenty of pillows. There was enough space in the room for one person with not too much of luggage, and the bathroom was ok as well. The rate did not include breakfast and as the normal rate for breakfast is quite expensive, I had my breakfast outside of the hotel.
